Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel”
Reviews.Author: rbach
Reviews.Content: Rooms are beautiful. Service was very nice. Just wish they had some sort of gift shop or vending machines. Capital grill was excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Expensive but worth it.”
Reviews.Author: Marie925
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were in town for a conference. We stayed 4 nights. The room was very large and comfortable. I had to call the front desk for fiber fill pillows because there were only down in the room. At check out there was a mistake with our reserved shuttle but it was taken care of very quickly. For a business trip this was an expensive hotel. It would be totally worth it if the trip was for pleasure. Mostly we didn't have time to enjoy the amenities.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal location”
Reviews.Author: Anniebonnie
Reviews.Content: The Conrad is an elegant choice for downtown. Luxurious bath and comfortable bedding, with a view of the city. Close to everything you could wish to do. We ran out and picked up dinner at Buco de Beppo next door. Crossed the street to the Arts Garden and the Circle Center.

Reviews.Title: “I'd like to live here!”
Reviews.Author: Jacmo
Reviews.Content: Stayed for a couple of nights at the Conrad while in town for a trade show at the convention center. Two days before our arrival the concierge emailed asking if we needed anything for our stay and offered to range discounted car service. We took them up on this offer as it wasn't much more than cab rides and I like car service because there is no searching down cabs nor do you worry about them taking 'the long way' to your hotel. The concierge took are of all of it and our driver was there waiting for us as we entered baggage claim. Very nice. We arrived quite early, before lunch. Even so they allowed us to check in. We were upgraded to a city view on the top floor without charge as Gold HH members. We were offered water as we waited to check in. I find this simple thing to be such a nice touch since bottled water in hotel rooms is always so expensive. Every contact we had with an employee was stellar. Every one was smiling, happy to work there and were very helpful. Quality staff for sure. The room itself was lovely. Nice furnishings. Wonderful bathroom. Work desk, seating... all of it was enjoyed. We loved that the hotel is connected to a mall via a sky walk. Easy access to the food court was great. It was wonderful not having to go outside to get to the convention center. I love the skywalks! We have to travel to Indy every year. The Conrad will be our Indy home!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Downtown location”
Reviews.Author: CDEMOM
Reviews.Content: Really like the service, helpful and with a smile always. The location cannot be beat. You can walk to almost anywhere within downtown and feel safe. The city view at night is an added bonus. Note: Valet Parking is $33 but then you cannot escape parking fee while in Downtown.

Reviews.Title: “Much Better!”
Reviews.Author: Indyblonde
Reviews.Content: Our first couple of stays at the Conrad were so-so, not because the hotel isn't comfortable, but mostly because of service. Now it's one of my favorite hotels, and I wish it was closer to home. The rooms are wonderful and comfortable, suites are also good, bathrooms are big with TV and cool showerhead...and I especially like the bar. Interesting wines, and food. Served by very competent people. They have several of those turnstile thingies that serves a taste of many different wines. Lots of hotels have those, but the Conrad has LOTS. Downtown Indianapolis is small and very entertaining, with lots of street activity, restaurants, ice cream shops, shopping. And the hotel is right in the middle of it all. Very nice. Treat yourself.

Reviews.Title: “Top Notch”
Reviews.Author: kelly8088
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Conrad on Superbowl weekend. Hotel is in an excellent location, rooms are absolutely perfect, clean and quiet. Service by all staff is extremely attentive and best I have seen!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent all round hotel”
Reviews.Author: al1wolf
Reviews.Content: Two day business conference with three nights stay. Excellent facilities - massive flat screen tv, sofa, marshmallow bed, tele in the khazi! Restaurant food I couldn't fault - that was three breakfasts, two lunches and an evening meal. Staff very friendly. Only things to watch for - mini bar expensive and the breakfast can take a while - leave yourself time. Location was excellent - superb atmosphere in town in the run up to the super bowl.

Reviews.Title: “Oasis of Luxury for Mother-Daughter Weekend!”
Reviews.Author: ilona06
Reviews.Content: Excellent location, room exceptionally clean and exactly as described, with ample desk and work area, as well as large seating with couch, chairs and coffee table in the "deluxe king" room. With a large soaking tub and well placed flat screen TV for viewing while soaking, along with a large walk-in shower, the bathroom was one of the nicest I've experienced (rivaled so far only by the bathroom in the Raffles hotel in Singapore!). We ordered one dinner and two breakfasts from room service, and delivery was within 30-40 minutes, hot and delicious. Front desk and concierge were both very helpful and friendly. Spent the afternoon at the Evan Todd Spa, where Jeff worked wonders with a relaxing aromatherapy massage, and Kelly renewed my horribly dry skin with a fantastic moisturizing facial. My daughter also had her hair shampooed and styled at the hair salon, and loved her look and the pampering as well. Every inch of this hotel is impeccably decorated, and we loved the short connecting walkway to Circle Center Mall. We didn't use the pool, but did check it out, and the families with little ones were clearly loving it! Will highly recommend to anyone traveling to Indianapolis, and hope to return soon!

Reviews.Title: “Back again, and even better”
Reviews.Author: LouisvilleWildcatfan
Reviews.Content: I was here back in November. In spite of it being a busy weekend in Indy, (Cheerleading competition), they upgraded me to a corner suite. 4 tvs! 2 baths , a large bedroom with a large sitting room. I was in town with my 9 year old for a swim meet. Because of the hotel, it was actually a relaxing weekend. The service here is phenomenal This time we used the spa for a manicure and it is beautiful, all Aveda products. The service, again, is great Shopping is nearby at the circle centre (across the street), and you do not even need to go outside...there are heated crossways everywhere. I will go to the swim meet anytime, if I get to stay at the CONRAD

Reviews.Title: “Best choice if in Indianapolis”
Reviews.Author: T15T
Reviews.Content: The Conrad is in a perfect location, right downtown attached to the Circle Arts Centre/Mall, a few blocks from the Entertainment District, and very close to everything else in this compact city. I really enjoyed the fact that there was so much right within the hotel grounds. I could walk through the 2nd Floor of the Hotel into the mall, to the food court, downstairs to restaurants both casual and upper class such as Panara Bread or Ruth's Chris Steakhouse; cinema, and everything else downtown Indianapolis has to offer. I saw both standard rooms and a corner suite. The standard room was just that- small and basic and clean. The corner suite which I ended up staying in was very nice, large entrance way to the living room and guest washrom, followed by a large master bedroom and comfortable en suite bathroom with shower and tub. I expected the tub to be larger in such a suite, possibly even a jacuzzi. Not so. It was decorated finely and felt more like a condo living space. I ordered room service twice: for dinner and breakfast. All other meals I went into the mall or restaurants downstairs or outside. The dinner was a Kobe Burger which was delicious-however the bun was not. The service was extremely friendly which made up for a crappy bun I wasn't going to stress over. The breakfast was great- lots of added touches. I did not visit the fitness center or pool so cannot comment. Really enjoyed the locale of the hotel and all the things to do within a short walk (or even covered walk inside). There was some confusion with the bill at the end of the stay which could have been handled better, and the guest services agent was not being proactive to get a manager to sort out the issues he did not know how to fix. Hailing a taxi was interesting as 3 door men stood around chatting and it took way too long to get my taxi to the airport. Otherwise, had a great friendly stay at The Conrad.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: RJ P
Reviews.Content: Stayed here New Years Eve. Service was great and room was nice. I thought valet parking should be included when the room cost what is does but it was an additional $33 for overnight.

Reviews.Title: “Probably the best hotel in Indianapolis”
Reviews.Author: Josh C
Reviews.Content: Great staff, smaller but clean rooms. I have stayed here a few times and have never had an issue. One of my children had a cold and when I looked for the hotel store, the staff asked what I needed, ran to the store and came back with it. Simply wonderful. The Capital Grill for breakfast in the lobby was great as well.

Reviews.Title: “Worst Hotel Stay EVER in 40 Years”
Reviews.Author: Karen G
Reviews.Content: It was my 30th wedding anniversary, and since my husband had a discount at his Firm, we chose to stay at the Four Star Conrad in Indianapolis. The room was clean and terrifically decorated and equipped; the marble bathroom was “die for” but after an engineer came up to fix our television, every time the occupants of the next room slammed their heavy room door, the TV flicked off. At 10:00 p.m. we retired for the evening. Around 11:40 PM, I was awakened by the loud party next to our room. Their door would open, someone would shriek like a banshee, music would boom out, and lots of loud voices and laughter could be heard. I’d fall back to sleep. Then, another guest would show up, same thing. The coup de grace was when a loud male voice announced (in a non-smoking hotel -- 17th Floor that is) that he needed a lighter to light his cigarette. I stumbled to the phone and called the front desk (Conrad Services). The obsequious voice at the other end said he would send Security, which he did. The Security man talked to the twenty-something young woman who registered the room; she had 8 or more people partying with her as guests. As soon as Security left, same thing. My husband woke up and went to the phone and complained. Security came up again; told the party next to us to be quiet. As soon as he would leave, the noise would start again. After the second visit from Security, the music next door was no longer audible, but the talking and laughing and shouting got all the louder. My husband swears he also heard noise coming from another party a couple of rooms to the left of our room. For all we know, there could have been people moving between the parties in the two rooms. There was an outer security door in the hallway, separating our room and the room to the right (containing most of the party noise) from the rest of the guest rooms on our west end of the 17th floor. One of the partygoers decided to shut that security door (which needed a guest room pass card or a key to open), so we were essentially locked in with this going on next to our room. Each time Security came up, the security man would unlock that security door and prop it back open, and 5 or 10 minutes later, one of the partyers would shut it again. One of the guests came out, shouting, “I’m leaving. Give me your elevator pass card.” My husband called the front desk again. He said the noise was intolerable. More people arrived looking for the party; my husband, standing at the door’s peephole in his undershorts, saw two of them. A thirtyish man in a black suit, holding the necks of two bottles of champagne in one hand, was loudly looking for the party. On the fourth call, the man at Conrad Security assures us that the party was being moved to the 2nd floor (Why they did not do this to begin with is a mystery). As the party left, my husband counted ten people walking out, one carrying a chest-size cooler and another one a boom box. The front desk was checking their room inventory because he said there was no guarantee that there wouldn’t be loud noise when these people returned to their room. My husband hung up. So, at about 1:15 A.M., as we were getting ready to pack up and possibly check out and drive 76 miles home, the phone rang. It was the front desk. We were told that a bellman was coming right up to move us to a different room, on a different floor. Of course, the bellman could not reach our room because the partygoers had shut that security door again on their way out. Do you know what it is like to repack your belongings to go to a different room in the middle of the night? For this nightmare, our stay was free of charge, and we were given two breakfast vouchers worth twenty dollars for the Capital Grille. And, mind you, a breakfast including two eggs over easy cost fourteen dollars, and a 3-egg omelet was $12 or $13. For a top hotel like the Conrad, a reputation for incomparable customer service is the most important asset. We were grateful to be “comped” for the room instead of being charged, but why did it take 4 calls and more than 90 minutes to reach a solution to this party noise problem? To sum up, a four- or five-star hotel doesn’t mean you are not going to be put in a room next to folks with total lack of manners and respect for others. I think a Motel 6 or Red Roof Inn would have been better. At least, I could have called the Police. P.S. When I needed coffee, the coffee machine in the second room didn't work.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel in Indy”
Reviews.Author: AJR2000
Reviews.Content: By far this is the best hotel in Indy, probably the nicest hotel I have ever stayed in. Make sure to get a package deal that has your valet, breakfast (at Capital Grille!), and gift card to Tastings (wine bar). The fitness room is terrific and well stocked with towels, water, fruit, and ear buds (for those who forgotten them...like me). This is a a great place for romance. I would highly recommend to anyone! I like the security added feature that you can't get up the elevator until you scan your card and each person who selects another floor has to scan their card as well.

Reviews.Title: “Worth every penny!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: MJWorline
Reviews.Content: My wife and I drove about 3 hours the day after christmas to go to Indy and kind of wind down after the holidays. From the moment we checked into our room to the moment we checked out the staff treated us like we were their number #1 priority. The valet service was kinda pricey at $33 but it was worth every penny. Was walking distance to the Pacers game, Circle Centre Mall, and a multitude of great places to eat. The room was amazing with a great view of the city. I could go on and on about how great the staff was and how great they treated us. This will be the ONLY place we stay whenever we vist this great city!!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: mrssrb
Reviews.Content: Stayed there for a work conference & FFA was in town. Hotels were hard to find, but I feel I found one of the best in town. Hotel is awesome from all aspects. Staff was so helpful-had to ship something home & they we're more than anxious to help. Great location in downtown Indianapolis-close to many restaurants. Room was CLEAN! Big screen TV on Wall & TV in the bathroom! Bedding was luxurious as well. Excellent Property! Highly recommended!!!

Reviews.Title: “We'll be back!!”
Reviews.Author: KLKDO
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for the Big 10 championship game. Great downtown location. Staff was helpful even with the crowds. Great that you can use the enclosed walkway to get around. Don't need a coat in the winter! Pool is gorgeous. Capitol Grille in the lobby is a must for breakfast

Reviews.Title: “relaxing and elegant”
Reviews.Author: Jill093
Reviews.Content: Needing a vacation, but no time to travel - I checked in at the Conrad Indianapolis. Checking in, Leland was wonderful in making me feel welcome and appreciated as a guest. Location is great to walk anywhere downtown, but with Tastings, the wine bar and Capital Grille on the first floor - there is no need to go anywhere else. My room was clean, spacious and the bathroom was great. Loved using the fitness room ( they have everything), the indoor pool and the steamroom in the women's locker room on the 6th floor. It was a wonderful getaway, without the long travel. Every staff member I encountered was friendly and helpful, they always ask if there is anything you need. Loved it, can't wait to go again!

Reviews.Title: “NICE!”
Reviews.Author: LAlexander01
Reviews.Content: Loved my stay, enjoyed every moment (except for the shooting outside, got to love Indy), nice comfy bathrobes and slippers, nice deep jacuzzi tub with tv in bathroom. The bathroom scale needs to be thrown away. Loved the Keurig coffeemaker. Liked being on a private floor. The only negative is that they wanted a super high deposit hold on my debit card. The manager however was nice and did not charge a deposit.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, great service, good for business”
Reviews.Author: IndyTravel10
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Conrad several times for business, and it is consistently excellent. The rooms are very comfortable, the staff is helpful, and the location is the best in downtown Indianapolis. Easy walk to the Circle (including the monument and Hilbert Circle Theater), IRT, and many restaurants and stores. Relatively short walk to Eiteljorg, NCAA and Indiana State Museum as well as Victory Field. There are other fine, more affordable hotels in the area, but if you can afford it (or someone else is paying!), the Conrad is well worth it!

Reviews.Title: “Good location and great hotel”
Reviews.Author: msmxtoo
Reviews.Content: Right in the middle of downtown Indianapolis and close to restaurants, mall, stadium. This property is a high end hotel. The hotel open its doors less than 5 years ago. Everything is new and upgraded, Staff is helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Experience, Best Hotel in Indy”
Reviews.Author: Annie M
Reviews.Content: I love this hotel. I even enjoy the snootiness of the front desk associates, it’s strangely fitting. I’ve stayed at this hotel several times over the past few years. The location is excellent for downtown shopping (even though Nordstrom’s has closed), sporting events, and fine dining. If you do have a chance to stay here, please try the Evan Todd salon. The salon staff is wonderful and it’s a modern yet relaxing atmosphere. I love the shampoo chairs. The pool is fantastic and the fitness center is certainly better than the average hotel fitness center. The rooms are fantastic and the beds are amazing! I really enjoy the tea service they offer for an extra charge at night. The bathroom shower and tub are great…I really can’t say enough about how much I enjoy staying at this hotel. I have had a few minor things happen over the years. Turndown service is not consistent. It used to be offered all the time and now I don’t typically receive it at all. As a Hilton HHonors Diamond member I expect those types of perks on a regular basis, but it’s my understanding that all rooms receive nightly turn down service and I haven’t had turn down service for the past several stays…and I’m usually out at dinner until well after 10 p.m. I've had a few minor bleeps, TV in bathroom doesn't work, bathroom tub not properly cleaned, but these are things that frequent travelers sometimes encounter. Otherwise, this fantastic place with wonderful service. I would recommend dining at The Capital Grille or having drinks and small plates at Tastings. The Sunday tailgate also looks like a lot of fun…hope to go next football season and check it out!

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: IndianapolisShel
Reviews.Content: The amenities are wonderful here. We received a complimentary bottle of champange for our 5th wedding anniversary. Highly recommended, especially for people who love a modern feel close to the action in Indy. Don't forget to make reservations at the Captial Grille.

Reviews.Title: “Well-appointed downtown hotel”
Reviews.Author: Historybuff52
Reviews.Content: My sister and I stayed at the Conrad for two nights in October during a "girls' trip" to downtown Indianapolis. It is a lovely, very well-appointed hotel that is convenient to pretty much everything visitors want to do in downtown Indianapolis. Our room was very clean and comfortable and featured many "extras," including a TV in the bathroom and a wonderful shower with a double head (separate from a jetted tub). Unfortunately, our stay ended on a negative note when I discovered while packing to leave that my 1-quart plastic bag of small bottles of toiletries (the bag you're allowed to carry on an airplane) was gone. I reported the loss at check-out and was offered replacement toiletries, but the sorts of things in my bag -- cologne, hairspray, eye drops, make-up, lipstick -- couldn't readily be replaced. Consequently, whether the bag was accidentally or intentionally taken by housekeeping staff, I simply had to suffer the loss. Not a great final memory of a hotel. (I subsequently reported the loss again when I received from the hotel a survey to fill out about my stay, but I have heard nothing as a result.) Also, Internet service is not free, something I always find disappointing in a hotel..

Reviews.Title: “A five star that is starting to slip a bit”
Reviews.Author: Jerry H
Reviews.Content: This was at one time my favorite hotel in the US. However over the past few years it has started to slip. It's the little things that make a five star special and it seems those things are slipping away. The turn downs, the free shoe shine, knowing your name before you get to the desk. All these things made this a fantastic gem. As with any hotel things get frayed after a few years and start showing wear. Still a great property but with a JW Marriott down the street my hope is they kick it back into high gear. Also when checking out there needs to be more than one desk clerk at peak hours. To the mid-40's blond concierge who seemed to cool for school. Drop the attitude. Your job is to be there and if the hard working desk guy has guests 5 deep don't act put out when a guest hands you the room key. You are the Conrad NOT the Hampton. I can handle snark for $99 a night not $479.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay for son's B-Day”
Reviews.Author: MDHKLR04
Reviews.Content: We spent two nights for my son's 9th birthday at the Conrad. The room was great, clean and well appointed. My two sons ages 6 and 9 thought that is was "cool" to take a shower and watch TV. The beds are by far the most comfortable of any other hotel chain, we all slept well. The central location is also a plus. We were fortunate to have our room on the 18th floor with a nice view of the state capitol dome. The one thing that is even my 9 year old son mentioned was how nice everyone is here Dad, I would be remiss if did not mention that that everyone here was far and above the best in customer service or customer care. From the valet to the housekeeping staff, everyone my family encountered was “warm and welcoming” they all seemed to care about their guests. World Class Service in the Circle City!!! The only drawback was on the first night when the room next to us was partying and play loud music at 2:00 AM, they woke all four of us up and those around us that mentioned to us in the hall the next morning. The Conrad security took some time to address it and when I mentioned it the next morning to the front desk they said nothing more than “sorry” as a Hilton Diamond member I was a bit disappointed. Also on the second night the hot tub was not functioning (no heat) not dire to me but my sons were quite disappointed and when I mentioned to the attendant she did not seem to do anything about it and I did not see anyone look into to the problem the entire hour I was at the pool. Still I would give the Indy Conrad a first class rating anyway!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay for the Nite Ride 2011”
Reviews.Author: littlegiant10
Reviews.Content: We were a group of several couples participating in the NITE Ride which is a bicycle ride in the city of Indianapolis starting on a Saturday night at 11p. I made contact with Jeremiah, the front desk manager at the Conrad to help us with rooms. He was very accommodating--reserving us all rooms on the Spa floor together at a great rate. The reservation amount changed a couple of times between making the reservation and the stay. I corresponded by email in which he was always prompt in responding to me. We arrived at the hotel with a load of road bikes. They offered to allow us to keep them inside our guestrooms. We kept them in the garage where they park the cars on a high level floor. They were well protected. The rooms were cozy, clean and comfortable. Our only complaint was that we were unable to get a beer at the hotel or nearby at 2:30a when the ride ended. This was not our first stay here. We have always had great service and accommodations and we will come back. Hopefully we will be there for the Nite Ride 2012!

Reviews.Title: “Consistently excellent.”
Reviews.Author: R W
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at this hotel several times. We always enjoy our time there. The staff is always helpful and the rooms are always very nice.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for a calm and relaxing weekend”
Reviews.Author: KEEPTRAVELLIN
Reviews.Content: When you think of planning a girls weekend, Indianapolis is usually not the first city to come to mind. But if you are looking to get away from things for a few days to relax and to spend the day at the spa, the Conrad Hotel in Indianapolis is the perfect choice. Rooms: The rooms are modern and elegant. The bathrooms are quite large with separate shower and large bathtub. If you just have to continue to watch your favorite show while brushing your teeth, you can do that with the television in the bathroom. The beds are comfortable and you can order from a pillow menu for additional comfort. Just ask about it and someone will be up to provide the variety of pillows available. The double beds, I believe, are a bit small for my taste, but the king size beds are quite nice. Spa: The day spent at the spa was just right. The staff were so very attentive and friendly. Make sure you book your treatments early. It looked like there were a lot of weddings and receptions going on in the hotel so the spa books up pretty fast. The prices are reasonable too so fill up on as many treatments as you can! Service: Hotel staff were friendly and always willing to answer questions about where to go for lunch, questions about the room, or just about anything. Anytime we asked for some assistance, room service or needed something for our room, the staff was right on top of it. We never wanted for anything. Transportation: The best way to get to the hotel is to use IndyGo's Green Line route. It takes you right to the hotel and back to the airport. It runs about every 20 minutes and is about $14 roundtrip. The hotel may suggest a car that can pick you up and take you back to the airport but I wanted to save my money for the wonderful spa treatments available at the hotel...so IndyGo was the choice. The hotel is a gem in downtown Indianapolis. No car needed. Everything (theaters, restaurants) was close by. Perfect location.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent for business meeting”
Reviews.Author: bjandljtravels
Reviews.Content: This is my fifth stay at the Conrad Indianapolis and each stay has been excellent. This visit was for a two-day business meeting held in mid-October. The meeting areas are well-appointed. The rooms are quiet and comfortable. Drinks and snacks were great. We had two lunches - both of them were delicious. All other aspects of the Conrad (room, service, parking) continue at their exceptional high standards. If you are considering a business meeting in Indy - you can't go wrong with this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: soontraveller
Reviews.Content: Top class hotel with modern and clean rooms, large bathrooms and nice amenities. The free shoe shine is a nice touch. Hotel is centrally located in downtown Indianapolis, and within easy reach to the mall and many restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel and very nice....but....”
Reviews.Author: tracythall1
Reviews.Content: I would have given this hotel a 5 star rating if there were not a few issues at hand. The hotel is very nice, the beds are very comfortable, the staff is very accommodating. When we checked in and they brought us up to our room it smelled like smoke and the smoke detector had been tampered with so it was buzzing. They upgraded us, no charge, to a smoke free room (we choose a non smoking room due to my son's recent asthma attack). The upgrade was AWESOME because we just got out of the ICU at Riley with our son and we were trying to avoid triggers such as smoke. Now the bad part. My mother in law needed an extra key to our room and I was not aware that she went down to get an extra key. This was completely fine, BUT The front desk gave her the key after she said she was staying with us and had the same last name. They did not ask for ID nor did they call up to the room to confirm this information. She just simply asked and got a key. I am staying here with my son, had I been staying alone - this is super scary that anyone can get a key to my room. The front desk person does not personally know me or my family. She only knows that my husband's name is on the room. I get that it is my mother in law and she knows me, had it been someone in passing or sitting next to me at a restaurant that happened to overhear where I was staying, that would have been different. I feel like there should be some type of protocol for safety like you need to check with the registered guest, check the persons ID or at the very least call the room to confirm. Not all of those things, but at least something to check the validity of the person requesting a room access key.

Reviews.Title: “A thing or two other restaurants can learn from the Conrad Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Starla W
Reviews.Content: Several weeks ago, I attended a luncheon at the beautiful Conrad Hotel in downtown Indianapolis. Upon arrival, we found an exquisitely decorated table. And, of course, as an etiquette consultant you know what I looked at next…the table setting! If the table setting is set correctly, guests should be able to look at it and immediately know which courses will be served. As expected, the Conrad Hotel gave us a perfect table setting. What was most impressive was the manner in which guests were served. First and foremost, the wait staff was professionally dressed. Their uniforms were well-maintained and the servers themselves looked put-together. Here lately, at four and five star restaurants, I've observed way too many servers that look like they just rolled out of bed! Kudos to the Conrad Hotel for knowing the appearance of its wait staff plays a critical role in how it is perceived by guests! One by one, guests were treated to a beautifully choreographed presentation of the meal. In unison, five to six servers emerged from the kitchen doors and, in single file, walked swiftly into the dining hall with plates in each hand. With excellent posture and pride in their step, they circled their designated table and stood at attention with all eyes on their lead server. After a brief pause, the lead server gently nodded his head at which time each server placed one of their plates in front of a guest. Returning to attention, all eyes were again on their lead server as they waited for his nod to serve their second guest. When finished, again in single file with pride in their step, they quietly returned to the kitchen. BRAVO! Applause! Applause! Even better…the hotel's wait staff served from the left and removed plates from the right which is the correct way to serve a meal. A true class act! Ladies and gentlemen, this is the most efficient way to serve a large number of guests. I am always disappointed when four or five star restaurants use the "large tray of meals" method to serve multiple tables. There are two things wrong with this. First, it is not efficient. Each guest is served one-by-one by a single server who inevitably runs out of meals before the entire table is served. As a result, the server must return to the kitchen while the guests who HAVE been served must sit and wait while watching their meal cool*. This approach can take anywhere between two and ten minutes to serve a single table of eight to ten guests! *It is bad form to begin eating before everyone at your table is served. Secondly, the clinking and clanking of plates along with ten to twenty servers scurrying in and out of the kitchen and throughout the dining hall is loud and distracting. Overall this dining experience at the Conrad Hotel was one of the best I've had in a long time in the Indianapolis area. I am thrilled to have the opportunity to say, "Congratulations Conrad Hotel. You are truly a class act!" One last note…I absolutely LOVE that the Capital Grille – a restaurant affiliated with the Conrad Hotel in downtown Indianapolis – immediately selects a color of napkin for its guests based on the color of their slacks or skirt. This ensures that noticeable lint will not be left on the guest. More sophisticated restaurants will always have white and black napkins available. Never hesitate to ask for a color that is similar to the color you are wearing. Unless, of course, you are dining at the Capital Grille where the maître d' takes the initiative to do that for you! If we choose to spend our hard earned dollars at a four or five star restaurant, we should most certainly expect to be treated to the finer details that make it a truly pleasurable experience. I am thrilled to say the Conrad Hotel and Capital Grille know how to do just that. Warmest regards, Starla West, Corporate Image Coach Starla West International

Reviews.Title: “Excellent All Around”
Reviews.Author: cbm3NYC
Reviews.Content: This was my second trip to the Conrad Indianapolis, and I have been duly impressed both times. The lobby and common areas are very appealing, attractive and welcoming. The staff is friendly, courteous and attentive. In both of my stays, my room was well appointed, very clean, attractive and comfortable. The bed was very supportive and the linens were good quality. The bathroom was spacious, well designed, had a high level of finish and was well above average. The gym was modern, well equipped and clean. The neighboring spa appeared to be quite nice, but I didn't use it during this trip. The quality of finishes, services, amenities and the overall look and feel of the hotel is comparable to most of the better Ritz Carlton or Four Seasons locations in which I've stayed. I would highly recommend this property for business or liesure.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent and unbeatable. Classy right downtown in the fun.”
Reviews.Author: Cakesman
Reviews.Content: No one could have any complaints with this exception property. Expect classy and you will find it better than you thought. Convenient and you could walk to hundreds of attractions, monuments, restaurants, etc. Excellent for night life and business or touring Indianapolis. When you have the money, you will not find better.

Reviews.Title: “A very nice hotel with great location.”
Reviews.Author: Michiganmomma
Reviews.Content: location next to circle mall joined by sky wall and art garden.

Reviews.Title: “Top Notch”
Reviews.Author: drums45
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a wonderful weekend in Indianapolis. The Conrad staff is attentive, sweet, and efficient. The hotel and restaurant (we only had room service) can't be beat. Our bed was comfy and the bathroom was impeccably clean! We drove in Indy for the Colts/ Steelers game and you can walk to many great restaurants, clubs and Lucas Oil Stadium. Indy is flat and lots can be had walking the downtown area. Room service 24 hours-nice. We had club sandwiches. We should have split one. Delicious and huge. There was a glitch in the kitchen, they called and said our food would take another ten minutes and offered us a free dessert. We chose a piece of chocolate hazelnut cake. It was as big as my head-lol. HDTV flat screen. The pool looked lovely. The only place we'll stay in Indy!

Reviews.Title: “Chic Service in the Midwest”
Reviews.Author: Loungesong
Reviews.Content: I agree with all of the other reviews that say this is probably the nicest hotel in Indianapolis. The room was beautifully appointed, sparkling clean, and extremely comfortable. Where I felt this Conrad really shined was in the service. The staff was extermely helpful and seemed to anticipate my every need...from offering water when I returned each night to the fitness center clerk getting my shoes shined while I caught a quick workout. This is a testament to the service training by management at this hotel: I found it considerably better than any other hilton property I've ever stayed at.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best stays I've had.”
Reviews.Author: Nimee1973
Reviews.Content: Super clean and excellent service. Love the bathroom. I'm used to having a tv in my bathroom so I felt right at home. They brought free bottled bottle by in the evening with ice so I didn't have to get myself! Turned my bed down and had music playing n the background. Felt pampered. Price was great too.

Reviews.Title: “One of the nicest hotels...”
Reviews.Author: StephaniB69
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for work recently and truly enjoyed my stay. Arrived and was placed in room 1409. Room was beautiful. Had a great view. The bed was so comfortable. Honestly that bed was the best one I have ever slept in. Sunk in tub with seperate shower. Took two bubble baths and watched tv while relaxing in the bath. The only problems I had were the noise from the hallway. People up and down the hallway laughing and talking loudly until 3am on a Wednesday night. Had to stuff a towel under the door each night to block out the hallway noise. And the other was the $5 bottles of water. Bring your own water! lol.. Great hotel convenient to everything in downtown Indy!!!

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and modern”
Reviews.Author: atima
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Conrad for two nights during a recent trade show in Indy. This was my first time at the hotel and found it to be clean, comfortable and modern. The room was spacious and easy to regulate temperature. Nice bathroom with stall shower and small LCD TV by the sink area. Very convenient location, easy to walk to shopping, restaurants, convention center etc. Capital Grille located right off of the lobby. Staff was very pleasant and helpful. Had a small issue where I wanted to grab a beer from the mini bar and found that some previous guest apparantly could not afford the $6 charge, so had refilled the bottle with water and replaced the cap. Have not seen that one before. Would definatly return.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, classy hotel”
Reviews.Author: LthePoet
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for a weekend get-away before he deployed and it was perfect for a relaxing weekend together. The front desk staff was courteous and efficient. When we called to get our room cleaned, we heard the message delivered to the housekeeping staff before we'd even left the floor! We also enjoyed the bar, restaurant, and spa. The pool was tranquil as well. If I ever go back to Indianapolis, I will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel find in downtown Indy”
Reviews.Author: phoaglan
Reviews.Content: The Conrad in downtown Indianapolis is a stylish yet friendly hotel. I was there for a convention and it was only $10-20 more than lesser hotels so on that basis it represented a good value. My only disappointment is the usual exorbitant charges for internet that the "full service" hotels gouge their customers with. I complained and they were good enough to waive them for me. Outside of that, this is an excellent hotel in every regard and with a great location.

Reviews.Title: “Stayed here many times. Hands down the best hotel in Indy”
Reviews.Author: LDL1980
Reviews.Content: This is worth the price, and frankly worth the trip to Indy. They treat every visitor as a high profile customer. The rooms are small, but amazing. The bathroom alone is worth the visit. They are huge with Televisions.

Reviews.Title: “Great Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: peyton0018
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for 1 night. Check in was quick and the staff was so accomodating. Everyone we dealt with was so nice, friendly and wanted to make sure we were taken care of. The room was well decorated, , the bed was so comfy. The bathroom was marble and spotless. Will stay here again!!!

Reviews.Title: “5 Star Hotel Service with Hoosier Hospitality Charm”
Reviews.Author: TravelinJB
Reviews.Content: They say Indiana is known for its "Hoosier Hospitality" - and the crew at the Conrad certainly has that trait, too. From the moment we arrived (a last minute check-in on a Saturday) we were in between a wedding ceremony and the reception and decided to stay there. They found us a wonderful mini-suite /that was still available but at the lowest rate they had. How great is that? We didn't even ask but they could tell that we didn't need to get a room there but wanted to accommodate us, as we were clearly rushing around. We were brought to a wonderful room and given a lovely bottle of champagne to celebrate our own recent engagement. (Also unnecessary, but showed how sincere and thoughtful they were.) The management and reservations staff was unbelievably friendly since our call 5 minutes ahead of time to our actual arrival and we will certainly stay there upon our next return.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: happyhappyhappy2
Reviews.Content: From the moment you arrive, you know you are in for treat. The hotel staff was friendly, attentive, and helpful. The rooms were very clean and nice; I did not see one with a bad view. We were at the hotel with a large group for a wedding. The hotel was booked to about a 75% occupancy the night before we arrived due to accommodating a large group (Washington Redskins). Despite it, the staff was still able to accommodate us with an early check in. The staff offered water (bottles) at check-in and check-out. We did have spotty wi-fi in our room, but the hotel removed the charge without hesitation. There's a Capital Grille connected to the hotel that was out of this world. This hotel comes HIGHLY recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Loved every minute of it!!”
Reviews.Author: beebahk
Reviews.Content: Conrad may not be the largest in Indie but it certainly was one of the finest I have ever stayed in around the world. Front desk staff was wonderful; Olivia stood out as an exceptional person working in the front line -- friendly, professional and efficient. The lobby was decorated in a subtle but stylish manner as was my room. Very tasteful! My room was a good-size one, with two couches and L-shape work desk. The bathroom was simply a wonder with a mini TV, a bathtub and a very chic shower (stylish shower head!) Okay, only complaint -- where are the jacuzzi and the sauna?? :) The restaurant provided a wonderful breakfast, though a little on the expensive side (but this is hotel eatery after all.) I highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant surprise ....”
Reviews.Author: kickdiver
Reviews.Content: Honestly, I am not sure if I stayed there in August or September .....but...Really did not anticipate a Conrad Hotel in Indi.....nice treat. Great location, room was rather smaller than what I usually expect, but no complaints. Very good service, comfi beds, loved the bar downstairs, great atmosphere and had some 'flights', great times! Walking distance to a 'meh' Mall, but, hey,it' s Indi.... Must say, it is not like a Conrad in Europe..(tad bit less high end)...but.... you can't go wrong staying here, flawless service.... great bang for your buck! When in Indi, we will be staying there again! Loved it~!

Reviews.Title: “It's been better in the past!”
Reviews.Author: Bleo13
Reviews.Content: The room was smaller than previous stay... Don't like that you have to pay for wi-fi. Other than that it was a decent stay at one of my favorite Indy luxury hotels. But I believe I will have to go with the JW Marriott next trip to Indy. :-( I hear it's a lot better!

Reviews.Title: “Luxury at every step! Loved the Tastings Restaurants!”
Reviews.Author: JnAMcGhee
Reviews.Content: Went for a girlfriends weekend of shopping, relaxing, & just getting away. Our room was very roomy, bed was extremely comfortable, & the bathroom was a retreat in and of itself! A deep, whirlpool tub that you can watch TV from or just lower the lights & soak! A stand-up shower with more faucets than I've ever seen in one shower before! The whole room was a perfect retreat when we came back from the local festival, relaxed in their indoor pool & hot tub, & we had plenty of room to get dressed up to dine in the delicious Tastings restaurant that is located in the first floor of the hotel. GREAT experience!! Room was a bit more than we would've normally paid, but we felt it was worth every cent!

Reviews.Title: “Only Complaint”
Reviews.Author: JonSouthBend77
Reviews.Content: This trip being our first to the Conrad, we thoroughly enjoyed ourselves as a family with our kids. The only thing me as a father would say is the type of UNprofessional service provided by Dmitri who smelled like a walking vodka and tonic. Not a very good example to my kids who wondered while he smelt funny. Overall, very nice hotel though and will return :)

Reviews.Title: “New, worth staying at.”
Reviews.Author: 2travelforever
Reviews.Content: Like the other reviewers have said, great shower and bath room. We had a minisuite with a couch so lots of room. Appreciated the large 42" TV and the mini one in the bathroom. Continental breakfast was great. Only slight negative was the young staff, not very knowledgeable about the area or the hotel. Also, the outside door staff enjoyed each other more than their jobs. Staff needs to be schooled better. Room was clean and the bed gave me a perfect night's sleep.

Reviews.Title: “Very comfortable. Highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: crobbmd
Reviews.Content: when we arrived, the room assigned had been inhabited by cryptosmokers. We were promptly moved to another room, even though the hotel was at close to capacity booking. Restaurants were very good. wine bar had a great selection of wines, and delicious tapas-type food. The Grill made great breakfasts.

Reviews.Title: “Exquisite boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: patmcglinchey
Reviews.Content: Only stayed one night last Friday and I was a beautiful location and the room was superb. Beautiful travertine baths with Grohe fixtures. Nice touches of excellence.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: goldarch
Reviews.Content: My fiancee and I stayed at the Conrad in Indianapolis(for the third time) this past weekend and it was pretty good. This hotel has the feeling of a "wana be four seasons" to us. The hotel is well kept, the rooms are very comfortable, and I like that it is connected to the mall on the 2nd floor. Located in the heart of downtown Indianapolis and within walking distance to the Indianapolis Zoo and Arts center. We had breakfast in the Capital Grill and it left MUCH to be desired. We would not have breakfast there again, we'd try our luck at the Panera Bread across the street. Valet Parking will run you a whopping $33.00/day, but we got a great deal on the room as a member of the Military for 4th of July weekend. We will gladly stay at this top notch hotel again, but will NOT be eating breakfast at the hotel. Oh and wireless internet costs 13.95 a day, kind of a rip off.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing and Run Down”
Reviews.Author: SusieS
Reviews.Content: My husband and I checked in the Conrad Sat., July 2 in response to a "special" the hotel was running. Since we live in Indpls., we planned a "staycation" to celebrate our anniversary. The lobby is quite average, and the hall carpet outside our room on the 12th floor was badly soiled. The carpet in the small room, the dust ruffle, and the upholstered bench at the foot of the bed were stained. The full-length mirror in the bathroom had hair product on it - little sticky spots. There was an almond on the floor of the closet - a whimsical touch but not for us! One of the reading lights made a loud buzzing noise. We complained twice about all of this and were told that housekeeping would receive a note. We checked out, did not stay, and got a refund. I even asked if that Conrad is the 5-star; I thought perhaps I'd mixed the 5-star up with the other Hilton downtown. No; that was it. It's run down, ordinary, and by my standards, dirty. We have stayed at 5-star, 4-star, and even 3-star hotels, and this did not meet 3-star criteria. The "special" was an insult, and I can't fathom how this dump receives 5 stars.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice but just not my style.”
Reviews.Author: 4starcashier
Reviews.Content: Okay, I'm going to say that this hotel was very beautiful, and I have nothing bad to say about the Conrad. I am a businessman, but I am just not into the parlor room look. If I had my choice (the conference I attended required that the attendees stay at the Conrad.), I would have chosen the Courtyard by Marriott. I dig the looks of either Hampton Inns or Courtyards because they are modern contemporary (though the Hampton Inn-Downtown Indianapolis was in a historic building, it didn't mean that the interior needed to be historic, as well...but this review isn't about that particular Hampton Inn.) Room service was excellent. Housekeeping was super friendly about washing my laundry. That alone is a great example of the excellent customer service they provide here. The room looked nice despite my lacking interest of the parlor room look. The bed was nice and comfortable and loved the feather pillows. I also liked the glass shower. I didn't try Tastings or Capital Grille (I tried ordering nachos from the Capital Grille, but it was one of the things they didn't offer). I ended up having nachos from Champps Bar & Grill across the street, and they were mediocre at best (but was far better than the Cici's Pizza I visited a few hours before....) I also like that the Conrad (along with Embassy Suites, JW Marriott and the Omni Hotel), is connected to the Circle Centre Mall (owned by Simon Properties, which are headquartered in Indianapolis), which has your middle to upper class stores such as Express, Johnston & Murphy, Forever 21, American Eagle, Abercrombie & Fitch, Brookstone, etc. My only complaint was the pool's size. You'd think for a luxury hotel, they would have a larger pool. The chairs alongside the pool with towels, apples and bottled waters were a nice touch. Not that I used it since I have my Sprint EVO 3D 4G and can use it as a hotspot (and by the way, unfortunately, Sprint service isn't the greatest inside the hotel...ESPECIALLY in the ballrooms), Wi-Fi Internet cost $13.95 per day. Anyways, if there was a more exciting lobby and more contemporary looking rooms to appeal to the young professional crowd like myself (I think the Conrad's target market consists of the Gen X/Baby Boomers), This hotel would have received five stars.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: SAGlobetrotters
Reviews.Content: Deserves its Trip Advisor rating. Great service from all the staff. Large and modern rooms. Bathrooms are amazing with double shower heads - probably the best shower I've ever had! Conference facilities and food are first class. Restaurant highly recommended if you like steak. Well located. Never stayed at a Conrad hotel before, but certainly will again after this experience.

Reviews.Title: “A really nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: PellegrinaIsrael
Reviews.Content: We went to the Conrad on a surprise birthday trip, and stayed in one of the suites. It has a great location, the beds were comfortable, and someone has wonderful taste in artwork. The decor itself was very nice but a bit hotel-like; the bathtub was one of the best I've ever been in in and American hotel, and overall the suite was furnished with everything we needed. The staff had a very helpful attitude, which the execution didn't always match (e.g., we left a bag with them for security since the room safe wasn't working, and it took them about 15 heart-stopping minutes to locate it afterwards; we asjed for ice, and they took half an hour to bring it up to the room). The only meal we ate in the hotel was breakfast, but that was quite good and met our expectations.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel, poor transportation”
Reviews.Author: carrierheatingandcoo
Reviews.Content: Hotel great, very clean and friendly staff. The transporation they provide is very poor. the driver patrick smelled of marijuana, was very on edge, i was actually on edge that he could even drive. he was on his cell phone cursing and yelling. for an upscale hotel you would think they would screen the driver's!!

Reviews.Title: “Conrad's are fantastic.....try this one............”
Reviews.Author: Imareserve
Reviews.Content: Extremely friendly and helpful..........even the custodians and maintenance guys we saw. Exceptionally clean. The Wine tasting restaurant and Capital Grille are both right there and both are very friendly with delicious food and superb service. Beds very comfortable and sheets are extremely soft and pleasant. Very easy to get over to the mall without having to walk outside. Not too many Conrad hotels in the US.........I would highly recommend trying this one.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent experience!”
Reviews.Author: travel24x7
Reviews.Content: I was at the hotel for meetings and really enjoyed my visit. The hotel staff was extremely friendly and helpful! The rooms were plush and the beds were very comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “fabulous in indiana”
Reviews.Author: lenorbingham
Reviews.Content: I am happy for my daughter who has just graduated from IU in Bloomington. I am sad because four years ago when she started school, we discovered the Conrad. Since the beginning, The Conrad had impressed us every time. The staff is amazing, the beds are comfortable, and the restaurant is delicious. We love the gym and always arrange a facial in the spa. This is a must. A new spa has just taken over the previous space and it did not dissapoint. Great spa experience with Aveda products. Every person employed is kind and helpful. I travel a lot and this is not the norm. I met the owner in the gym and I can see why the Hotel runs the way it does. He was sincere, sweet, and helpful when he overheard me with a problem with a door. You can tell that people care and I will have to think of a reason to return to the Conrad. Maybe for just a great hotel experience.

Reviews.Title: “Room was as stated”
Reviews.Author: rawdogg
Reviews.Content: The reviews pretty much cover it all . The room and the hotel were nice. Did not have to use the hotel service but the staff was friendly. Our room was great I guess my complaint would be the parking fee , no fridge in our room and no free internet. Maybe the other rooms come with a fridge. We just had a king with a city view. However the location was great and if i return i will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Stay”
Reviews.Author: tsogl
Reviews.Content: I found the Conrad Indianapolis to be a lovely hotel. The service was excellent and the facilities outstanding.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice”
Reviews.Author: MDI1
Reviews.Content: We spent a night in Indianapolis and were very pleased that we chose to stay at the Conrad. The room was spacious and the bed was very comfortable. The hotel's location was also nice as there were many good restaurants and shopping close by.

Reviews.Title: “I Didn't Want To Leave!”
Reviews.Author: skmvy
Reviews.Content: I spent four fabulous nights at the Conrad in March of 2011. What a treat! The decor is tasteful, the staff friendly and efficient, the room was spacious and beautiful, and the bed was more comfortable than my own. I dined in both Tastings and The Capital Grille, and loved everything I ordered, from breakfast to a late night burger. If I ever find myself in Indianapolis again for business or pleasure, I will definitely treat myself to another stay at the Conrad!

Reviews.Title: “Bathroom Lights and Elevator Frights!!!”
Reviews.Author: pinkmingos
Reviews.Content: Yes, the hotel is very beautiful with a luxurious feel- but you can read that in all of the other reviews. Here are some of the items that I thought were most pertinent: -Valet parking is $33 a night. We found that a bit steep, considering additional tips. We decided to park at an overnight parking garage (Merchant's Garage, I think). It was $16 for 24 hours and less than a five minute walk from the hotel, which we figured would be faster than doing valet. Do some research on Google Maps to look around for what is best for you. -Yes, the elevators are fast, but they also say that you are on the desired floor seconds before you actually stop. This gave me a few brief heart attacks when going to the lobby thinking that we were crashing into the ground. -The rooms are very nice, but somewhat small for what I expected. We had a King room. -The TV is very large for a hotel, but with a limited channel selection. I don't think anyone really wants to watch the exercise channel when on vacation or on a business trip. -The bathrooms are FANTASTIC and very clean. I did not find any hair in the shower like I normally do in other hotels. They include a soaking tub, glass shower with a duel shower head, phone, TV, dimming lights, hairdryer, and a make-up mirror. Towels are over sized. -Lots of fun bathroom goodies including shampoo, conditioner, shower gel, soap, body lotion, q-tips, dental picks, mouthwash, nail file, and a dental kit (which includes the smallest- and therefore, cutest- toothpaste I have ever seen. The products were all very nice and of good quality. -The hotel offers free bottled water at the desk if you ask. However, it is not chilled. -Turn down service includes getting the bed ready, dimmed lights, light sconces by bed turned on, music, and free bottled water and ice. -We ate breakfast at the Capital Grille using the coupons we were given (I think because we are Hilton Honors members). They were good for a free continental breakfast (assorted pastries and fruit with coffee, juice, etc.) or $10 off a meal. My husband opted for a meal that included eggs, potatoes, bacon, toast, fruit, and coffee (normally $14). I got the Healthy Start meal with came with fresh fruit (strawberries, blueberries, and blackberries) and tons of yogurt and yummy granola (normally $11). Both meals very excellent. However, it was a very fancy restaurant, and we felt under dressed in jeans among the business travelers we dinned near. However, when we left we saw many others dressed like us. It was hard to tell what the dress was before entering because you cannot see into the restaurant before you enter. -The hotel is connected to a sky walk (called the Arts Garden), which will take you to the Circle Centre Mall (lots of good shops!), without having to go outside. -Yes, the hotel charges for internet, but we saw a sign in the Arts Garden for free wi-fi. It is connected to the second floor of the hotel with lots of places to sit if you really don't want to pay. -There are plenty of restaurants surrounding the hotel, Rock Bottom Brewery, Weber Grill, Panera, Champps, Hard Rock Cafe- just to name a few. Overall, we were both very happy with our stay and would return again.

Reviews.Title: “5 stars and more”
Reviews.Author: indytraveler1
Reviews.Content: Stayed for one night March 19th, had two rooms, was on a govt leisure rate of $91, so I had an amazing deal before even checking in. But the Conrad goes above and beyond what ordinary hotels do for service ( which is what they are known for). We were celebrating a childs birthday, so I called the desk that morning to ask about an early check-in( kids wanted to swim). They graciously went out of their way to make sure that happened, and left a small box of chocolates at turn down that evening. All employees were helpful, and the rooms were immaculate. Huge flat screen in the bedroom, another smaller in the bathroom, along with a soaking tub and a separate glass shower. Beds were very comfy. Didnt eat in the restaurants so cant comment on the food. Only thing I would ask is free wi-fi should be a given at this type of hotel ( its $13.95 a day). This hotel definitely deserves the #1 rating in Indy.

Reviews.Title: “My Conrad Birthday”
Reviews.Author: deborahdorman
Reviews.Content: I was fortunate this March 7th to celebrate my birthday with 20 of my closest family members all at the Conrad in Indianapolis. They came from L.A., Boston, Chicago, Florida, Cincinnati, and right here in Indianapolis. They all stayed at the Conrad and felt like 5 star guests. They were treated royally and anytime they needed something, it was only a phone call away.They swam, they shopped at the attached Circle Centre Mall, and ate in some of Indys best places. Yet the BEST places to eat were right here in the Conrad, Tastings, The infamous Capital Grille(a smaller family gathering for 7) and of course my big birthday dinner was on the 2nd floor in the London room for 26 people. It was so spectacular, the food, the display of the food, the service from Greg and Kevin, etc. you can not imagine until you have had the experience yourself. Thanks to Liz Mok from the Conrad who arranged it all for me and then had Kevin and Greg and The Conrad Kitchen do all the rest. I do think that atleast once in your life you need to have a party whether big or small at the Conrad so you too will get the gift of a 5 star royal treatment. My family has come and gone yet the memory will be with them forever of a great time here in Indy's best hotel and i know my sisters were thrilled to be able to thank the owners of the hotel personally for their great stay...!!!!!!! My birthday was the best ever...Thank you Conrad and staff for a job well done. Deborah Dorman

Reviews.Title: “My experience was a positive experience!”
Reviews.Author: susansole
Reviews.Content: I would highly recommend it! Would certainly stay again, and the LIGHTING was superb! Every strength on the dimmer made me look 20 years younger! Cancel the facelift!

Reviews.Title: “5 Star, excellent service and wonderful stay!”
Reviews.Author: IndyMel_13
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here with one of their package deals for a room plus Museum package. What can I say, beautiful hotel, great atmosphere, great location and great staff. I would recommend this hotel to anyone who is looking for a romantic or business stay in Indianapolis.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel but some bumps”
Reviews.Author: AuroraMom
Reviews.Content: This is a very nice hotel, with a great location and lots of pluses! The location is fantastic. The valets were so nice and helpful with directions, the check in went well. The problem that seems easy to fix and yet so many guest were having trouble with was the elevators and ice. Seems trivial but oh, so annoying. We and many of the guests did not completely understand how much the room key is needed. Ice is not on every floor, and this is not explained, nor the fact you need your room key to access the ice on a different floor. We felt silly, but not when three other couples were doing the same thing, and were just as confused. Hello people, you don't want your guests feeling like they are committing a crime, because they want some ice. After that fiasco, where thankfully we all had a giggle, there was a nice evening service with water and ice delivered. The fact the Capital Grille is located in the hotel, was a wonderful convenience. A wonderful restaurant whose prices reflect their excellence. Tastings was a lot of fun at night. The fact there are so many wines to taste was fun, if not a bit pricey. The nice plus is that you can buy a bottle of one of your favorite selections at a price close to retail. The small plates and appetizers were delicious! The rooms were well appointed, and bathrooms were roomy and upscale for sure! The bed was very comfortable and the flat screen TV was great. Not so great, the fee for wireless internet! Hello, it is 2011!! To get free wireless I guess you have to go to the Panera next door. For $300 a night and up, free internet should not be even questioned. I have been a Hilton Honors member for over 20 years, but was not at the correct level, ugh. That little thing had my husband fuming. Not worth whatever little they are making on it, for the bad will they create.

Reviews.Title: “Good, but not perfect”
Reviews.Author: mommyamy
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Conrad for a belated Valentine's Day celebration; we live in Indianapolis, so this was a "staycation" for us. The Conrad has a great reputation here in town, so our expectations were high going in. The lobby is gorgeous with a lovely Chihuly-style light fixture. Common areas appear very clean and well-maintained, and the indoor pool/whirlpool area was great, although we did smell very strongly of chlorine after a dip in each. Our upgraded room on the 18th floor had an awesome view of Monument Circle and downtown to the east. The room itself was nicely decorated with a huge bathroom that contained a soaking tub, separate shower and television (very luxurious). Our only minor complaints - the full-length mirror in our room hadn't been cleaned very well and was streaky, and the drain in the bathtub didn't seal completely so water slowly leaked out. We semi-solved that problem ourselves by covering the drain with a washcloth, which helped, but at these room rates, we really felt everything should be perfect. We enjoyed a glass of wine in the on-site Tastings wine bar, then had dinner at the on-site Capital Grille. We ordered continental breakfasts from room service the following morning. Both the service and the quality of the food were very good, but definitely not cheap. Overall, our whole stay was relaxing and enjoyable, but it was definitely a big splurge for us and not something we'd do on a regular basis.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel.”
Reviews.Author: BobcatGirl04
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Conrad twice now for business. Both times, I have been very pleased overall. The service is top-notch. Rooms are modern, clean and comfortable. The elevators are FAST! :) Tastings and the Capital Grill both have great food and drink options right there in the hotel. The hotel location is perfect - right in the center of everything. My favorite thing about the hotel is the fitness center. It is the absolute best of any hotel fitness center I've used. Highly recommend!!

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't be better!”
Reviews.Author: abbalish
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Conrad for two nights when we came to town for a basketball game, using my husband's HHonors points. The hotel is beautiful! The bed was super comfortable, and the bathroom was great with a big soaking tub and a TV. Nice big TV in the bedroom. The indoor pool was maybe the nicest I have seen, and the gym was great. We especially liked the evening turn-down service. The location cannot be beat - you walk out the door and in all directions are tons of bars and restaurants (Champp's, Rock Bottom, Weber Grill, Buca di Beppo, Palamino, PF Chang's, Morton's, just to name a couple) Easy walking distance to Conseco Fieldhouse. The hotel is connected to the Circle Centre Mall so you don't even need to go outside if you don't want to. Valet parking is a bit steep at $33/night, but whatever - we'll definitely be back when we return to Indianapolis.

Reviews.Title: “Why would you stay anywhere else in downtown Indianapolis?”
Reviews.Author: Jerrod73
Reviews.Content: The Conrad was exceptional from beginning to end. Our stay was 'just for the fun of it' and to do some shopping at circle centre mall. Access to the mall was all indoors and allowed us to avoid the snow and leave our coats behind when we shopped. All the amenities we expect from a five star hotel were present, and more. Service was above and beyond anything we could have expected. We had picked up some flowers at a corner stand on the way to Indianapolis. When we arrived, they took our flowers and delivered them to our room arranged in a vase. Turn down service when we arrived back after dinner was a pleasant surprise as well. We visited the pool and it was a perfect temperature (I would say 85), The oversize jacuzzi was grand as well. We enjoyed our stay and HIGHLY recommend the Conrad Hilton if you're anywhere near downtown Indianapolis, Indiana.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel although varying check in experiences”
Reviews.Author: MrsSpike34
Reviews.Content: This is an excellent hotel with top notch service. I have stayed here twice in the last month and am very impressed. Both rooms were spotless, including ledges, corners etc. The housekeeping and service staff was outstanding, I called down for more cream for my coffee and within five minutes a suited gentleman was outside with a pitcher of cream and extra coffee for the Keurig as well. In the evenings turn down service includes a bottle of water, they will also tune your radio to soft music and dim the lights. Nice to return to after dinner. If you are a Hilton Gold or Diamond member you will receive vouchers for free breakfast or $10 off prepared breakfast which is served in the Capital Grill. Gold and Diamond members also receive Internet service for free. The eggs benedict and egg white omelets are great, as is the fresh fruit/yogurt/granola breakfast. I see there are complaints that there was only a single bottle of water, if you take the time to visit the nicely equipped gym facility on the sixth floor there is an abundance of water that is yours for the taking. They also provide headphones, extra towels and plenty of amenities in the locker rooms, a nice touch. Showers include a Grohe dual headed flip showerhead, there is also a separate soaking tub and a TV in the bathroom. What a luxury to watch the news while getting ready in the AM and enjoying my cup of Keurig prepared coffee. In general I felt like a pampered princess while staying here, the valet even stopped traffic so I could pull out in the AM, not kidding. I only wish my corporate rate would extend past this week, seriously, I would stay every week but it's back to the Homewood Suites for me (also a nice property). My only complaint is the somewhat uneven level of service from the check in staff. When I checked in my first night, the gentleman who helped me appeared somewhat disdainful. Maybe it was the corporate rate, who knows? I'm a Diamond Hhonors member though, and stay at Hilton properties 4 days a week/365 and I figure most Conrad guests are probably on a corp rate too, non? I asked him if they served hot breakfast at the restaurant and he said, "I'm getting to your vouchers." He never explained the internet service, didn't offer to have newspapers delivered, and was very unfriendly. My colleague who checked in with a different staff member had top notch service from someone who was very friendly, asked which newspapers she would like delivered, explained the breakfast vouchers and was just generally friendly. My check in staff member was the only downer, everyone else was great.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Hotel”
Reviews.Author: crnmd
Reviews.Content: Great hotel in downton Indianapolis, across from the mall and near Lucas Oil Stadium. Capital Grill in hotel as well as wine bar. Capital grill was outstanding for dinner and breakfast with great service. Not cheap, but well worth it. Hotel staff was courteous, helpful and efficient. Valet impeccable. Rooms are large with large flatscreen, big bathroom with sep. shower and all the extras. Good bed with a ton of pillows. No complaints about this hotel, you will not be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “The best hotel that I have stayed in while traveling for business.”
Reviews.Author: Azzurri17
Reviews.Content: I had the opportunity to stay here for a couple of days while in Indianapolis for business. I cannot say enough good things about the hotel. Everything was excellent. The service was quick and cordial from the moment that I arrived until I left. They were very attentive. The workout facility was clean and available 24 hours. Now to the real important stuff, the rooms. The rooms were spacious. Flat-screen TV mounted on the wall (I believe it was 42"). The bed was über comfortable. Bathroom was real clean. Great water pressure. Oh, there was a TV in the bathroom too. Location wise, this hotel is walking distance to a mall and theater and there are far too many restaurants to count as soon as you walk out the door. This will be my hotel of choice when I return to Indy.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Stay”
Reviews.Author: whalegirl69
Reviews.Content: We came to Indy for a football game. Despite being an upscale hotel, we felt welcome at all times. Staff were attentive and helpful. The rooms were comfortable and well appointed. I wanted to stay in my bed. I was fascinated with the unique shower head(adjusts up and down and has two separate heads). The tv in the bathroom was a nice touch as well. We had lunch at Capital Grill. After getting over our underdressed mortification(we had on jeans and game clothes) we enjoyed a delicious lunch. It was a great stay. I won't even try another hotel when we return to Indy.

Reviews.Title: “Luxurious weekend getaway”
Reviews.Author: hoosier789
Reviews.Content: My husband and I recently stayed at the Conrad Indianapolis for a weekend getaway; we live about an hour away. We couldn't have been more pleased! There are several hotels in downtown Indianapolis to choose from that are connected to Circle Center Mall via skywalk. I have stayed in a four others; none come close to the Conrad in terms of comfort and amenities! The bathroom boasts a huge garden tub, a separate, dual head shower, and a TV. I watched TV while taking a bath just for the frivolity of it. What fun! The coffee maker is a Keurig, the desk is huge, the robes are thick and warm. The bed was luxurious -- with down pillows, a feather bed, and a feather/down comforter. The TV is perfectly positioned for watching in bed -- and it is a huge (42 inch?), high quality flatscreen. We ordered room service, and while it was expensive, it was worth it. Fancy, delicious, and prompt. The valet parking was also expensive ($33), but the valets were friendly, polite, and boy were they hardworking! When you are ready to tear yourself away from your room, the Conrad's location pays off. Take the skywalk to the mall, or visit one of the many restaurants or bars that are just steps away. We will definitely return!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect, Beautiful, Will stay again!”
Reviews.Author: katey1109
Reviews.Content: The hotel is so beautiful. The perfect location downtown to everything! The room was clean and very nice. Tv in the bathroom was a plus! We will defiantly stay again. I recommend this to anyone. Worth every penny. Valet parking was so nice downtown, because it can be a little crazy. Walking distance to the mall and other attractions. Tons of restaurants and bars close by.

Reviews.Title: “my life at the conrad”
Reviews.Author: deborahdorman
Reviews.Content: my husband, p.a. and i have traveled all over the world and been in over 100 different countries to be exact. We also have made it a point to stay at the finest hotels in the world. P.A. being a world traveler and a european and me being in the travel business many years ago have been a perfect fit to see the world and live out our dreams through destinations whether it be hotels, resorts, cruises,etc. we do think we are very knowledgeable about the world and travel and hotels...Today we have had the opportunity to sell our home on the northside of indy and full fill our dream. we moved downtown(i am a realtor with Sothebys here in indy) and love the market here especially the downtown area. Upon moving making a decision to move downtown there was only one place we wanted to call home. Today we are living in the hotel at the Conrad. Al Kite and his gorgeous wife, Marianne are the real reason we have moved in here. This is a world class operation thanks to al, The extraordinare, Greg Tinsley, the gm, and Brad Lingle, operations manager..who make life at the Conrad a dream turned reality. The staff they have from the minute you walk into the hotel is the best we have ever seen from the spa, the restaurants,TASTINGS and the CAPITOL GRILLE, the housekeeping, the valet, it goes on and on...If you ever want to stay in a world class hotel in the heart of indy or have an event of a lifetime, or a wedding or honeymoon you have it all here at the Conrad. The decor is amazing a real sight for bright eyes to see...Oh yes, and we are attached to the mall, all the theaters, dining and a five minute walk to the museums and the canal...I could go on and on...i will as i share all my downtown memoirs ...if you are ever looking for a reference you must reach me personally....thanks again...deborah dorman

Reviews.Title: “Perfect 50th birthday weekend”
Reviews.Author: palgal
Reviews.Content: I spent the weekend at the Conrad with my husband and friends for my birthday and to attend a Colts game. We had a great time. Our rooms were very nice and the location could not be better. Excellent restaurants all within walking distance. The staff was very friendly and helpful. We plan on staying there again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: jechho
Reviews.Content: Stayed here one night in September and really enjoyed this hotel. Classy, with great service, and lovely restaurants. Do try the wine tasting bar, it was great to have a chance to sample a lot of wines! Compared to Conrad Chicago, this hotel is IMO actually better. Very attentive staff, nice breakfast area. Pricey, but worth it. I must admit I didnt find Indianapolis all that interesting, but locationwise this hotel is hard to beat.

Reviews.Title: “The customer is king”
Reviews.Author: OakvilleChipmunk
Reviews.Content: I held a corporate at the Conrad in Indy last weekend and the service was absolutely perfect. We suffered some logistical problems and the staff did everything they could to help us overcome them. Going the extra mile and simply part of a regular day's work at the Conrad. We did not stay in the hotel, so can't comment on the bedrooms, but every other area in the hotel was spotless. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value”
Reviews.Author: SophiaNYC
Reviews.Content: Good size, comfortable rooms. Great location and friendly, helpful staff. Exceptionally great rates for a first class hotel. What more can you ask for?

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely fabulous”
Reviews.Author: SEA001
Reviews.Content: A friend and I stayed here for one night- we felt spoiled and didn't want to leave the hotel! Right in the center of downtown Indy, the location can't be beat.Great service, clean, with friendly staff and a much needed comfy bed.
