Have a bottle of wine and some cheese downstairs at Tastings, sit outside if you can and people watch.

Reviews.Title: “Connie would be proud”
Reviews.Author: OSU_Sux
Reviews.Content: A wonderful hotel. The service is impeccable here from bellstaff to front desk. They have the perfect level of affability. Even completely discombobulated from the mess after the Colts game, the staff took me in stride as if nothing was wrong with this crazed guest. That's solid. The mark of a hotel's quality is always how they handle a tough situation. I was a bit tough. Long week of traveling, little sleep. Highway exits not marked very well as to where/when you should exit for downtown. On sleep . . . the drapes are so dark and the bed so comfortable, I could probably have slept all day. It was a noisy neighbor who woke me up, not sure what he was doing in there but it was pretty loud as the rooms are sound insulated quite well. Wrestling with the goose neck lighting or something. Who knows. My only complaint is that the Room Service menu is so steep since it comes from Capital Grille. Not that it's not worth the money but sometimes you don't want a full blown entree. Tastings is great although it is not a very welcoming space to the single traveler from a design standpoint and as good as the FD team was, the guys in Tastings were good but a little bit distracted despite the bar not being all that full. I also don't like that they are wearing Colts jerseys. I get why because of the fans and players coming in but they should do something more classy. We all agree that penguins suck, but let's get a standard uniform that incorporates an element of the Colts, something cute and funny. I felt like I was in BW3 and probably my perception of the service was worsened by what they were wearing. A great hotel otherwise.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best.”
Reviews.Author: AmandaBrady
Reviews.Content: My client suggested The Conrad in Indy for a recent business trip. As an executive recruiter, I stay in many hotels in leading business and finance cities around the country. The facility and the staff were top notch. The only thing I would suggest to the hotel is more sitting areas tucked away for private conversations. Sometimes you just can't take another cup of coffee but you need/want a comfortable place to have a meaningful business discussion. The restaurants and wait staff were great and the fitness facility was very nice.

Reviews.Title: “Definitely a Jewel In Downtown Indy”
Reviews.Author: Hoagy74
Reviews.Content: My family and I spent 3 nights in the Conrad in downtown Indianapolis. The service was top notch, the rooms were suberb and overall it was a great place to stay! The location alone made it all the more valuable since you could walk to virtually any place downtown. Circle Centre Mall is right across the street or through the Arts Garden. Valet Parking is easy and quick. And in spite of my children being typical 4 and 2 year olds, the staff were great with them!

Reviews.Title: “Wow. They thought of everything.”
Reviews.Author: gimmeproof
Reviews.Content: On a trip to Indianapolis (to see the DCI Nationals) - I read reviews on several sites (I worry that sites sometimes have 'forged' reviews), and chose the Conrad. Now, it's a bit more expensive that we normally go - but, for a short trip, we figured 'what the heck'. I must say - wow - what a very pleasant surprise. I assumed that (partially) the high price was due to the location. They have thought of everything here. The bathroom has a tv, light dimmer switch, great (usable) toiletries (you know how you get soap that sucks the life out of your skin in hotels? not here). And, a great (usable) makeup mirror The bed is sooo comfortable with the softest sheets I have ever slept on. The desk is big enough to be used on both sides (like a partner's desk). There are lots of choices in lighting (bedside lamp AND small halogen reading lamps, so you don't disturb your partner), so you feel like you are at home. In fact, everything makes you feel 'at home'. And, there is a huge mounted mirror - and, even a little 'shelf' and mirror right by the door (like you would have at home in a foyer). wow. I'm now going to look for Conrad's everywhere I go. Definitely a repeat.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service, Fine Wines & Good Scotch...!”
Reviews.Author: TAO-Traveler
Reviews.Content: Having stayed at over a dozen hotels this year, I have yet to find a venue that offers the universally wonderful service, combined with easy access to great casual dining, steakhouse fare and fine beverages--- that you'll find at the Conrad... It is rare to find hotel staff that make extra gestures to make your stay special. But at the Conrad, the person who toook my room service order ALSO delivered it to my room--- a few minutes later than promised... She apologized, noting that she had slipped out of the hotel to find a special sauce that I had requested with my meal...! Her special efforts were mirrored in ALL the staff that I encountered... And I have found that being treated well is more important than ALL the issue about beds and bathrooms... Tastings - (A wine bar just off the Conrad lobby) offers a unique, fun and educational opportunity to sample wines from around the world, in a casual atmosphere among friendly patrons. I actually wondered in simply to get a club sandwich--- the sandwich description on the menu seemed a bit too exotic for a simple sanwich... But the bartender assured me that they put a lot of thought in to their menu fare--- it was a GREAT sandwich! (...Who'd have thought that you could take a Club Sandwich to higher level....!LOL!) Capital Grille - (other side of the lobby) it easily accomodated my more formal business dinner and then my late night scotch sampling with colleagues. And nothing is more welcoming than when bartenders remember your drink order from one night to the next...! ...It is always nice to find great service in a hotel--- but it is even better to find that such great service extends OUTSIDE the hotel, to its affiliated restaurants...!

Reviews.Title: “Another Excellent Stay”
Reviews.Author: bjandljtravels
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Indianapolis Conrad - my second visit - during mid-July with my spouse. As with my previous trip, I had an excellent stay but was able to see more of the hotel on this visit. Specifically, the spa and pool area are absolutely outstanding. My wife spent two hours in the spa with a massage and thoroughly enjoyed the experience. The pool, hot tub, excercise area and changing areas (complete with showers, steam room, and dry sauna) are all top-notch. Having just stayed at the Indianapolis Marriott, the spa and pool are areas where the Conrad really destinguishes itself from the Marriott. The lobby and guest rooms are excellent as is the service in all aspects. The hotel accomodated my request for late check-out with no additional charge. The adjacent Capital Grill restaurant had excellent food (we only had appetizers.) My only complaint is that Conrad relocated their business center to a small room off the lobby (originally located on second floor near conference centers). This is a much noisier and generally less appealling location. I wish they would reconsider moving it back to the second floor near the conference rooms for the advantages of being quiet and private. All in all, if you can afford the Conrad, you can not go wrong.

Reviews.Title: “Another awesome stay”
Reviews.Author: sigs99
Reviews.Content: This was our second time to the Conrad. All I can say is...what a great hotel. The employees are over the top. Not one issue with any employee from check in to check out. The rooms are extremely clean and comfortable. The list goes on and on. If you stay here you will not be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Hope to stay here again”
Reviews.Author: antiem80
Reviews.Content: I was in town for the first time for a mini-convention organized by my co. Most of my co-workers were booked at another hotel. I got lucky and got to say at the Conrad. Beautiful, comfortable, friendly, professional...Attached to the hotel there's The Capital Grille restaurant (that I did not get to try) and a wine bar called Tastings that was phenomenal. My only complaint is that the Internet access was not free.

Reviews.Title: “A very pleasant break...”
Reviews.Author: peggysioux
Reviews.Content: I was acknowledged through work & received a w/end stay here. Our stay was just fantastic. Staff were so attentive & catered for our every need. If you are looking for a perfect location for that special occassion, I can heartily recommend the Conrad. Looking forward to our return visit , soon!

Reviews.Title: “Upscale Hilton; cleaner, fresher, better shower”
Reviews.Author: UTAustin
Reviews.Content: This was my first time to visit a Conrad and I was a bit skeptical as to what it would be like. The service was a bit shy of a Four Seasons, Mandarin, etc. However, the shower, towels, bed, and room were on par. The hotel lobby was very nice. However, the front desk staff was a bit confused by a basic question regarding laundry service. The rooms were very nice and clean. The furnishings were new and a bit heavy for my taste. However, there was no question they spent a lot of money on build out with guest comfort in mind. The shower had two heads with lots of water pressure. The towels were plentiful, plush, and fresh. They also had nice toiletries, including a disposable toothbrush and toothpaste. There was a television in the bathroom. It had a separate bathtub and shower. The bedroom had a nice working area with a good chair. However, as nice as the furnishings were they still had that Hilton feel to them, versus what you might find at a Mandarin Oriental or Four Seasons. The bed was very comfortable. It had lots of soft pillows and great sheets. It also featured two LED night reading lights. All in all, this was a clean comfortable place to stay at a competitive price. It has an area or two it could improve, but it's definitely in the top-tier of hotels in the area.

Reviews.Title: “I would stay here again”
Reviews.Author: JWC1978
Reviews.Content: Cleanliness: Hotel common areas were all very well kept. Location: Hotel is within walking distance to all downtown Indianapolis restaurants and attractions (e.g. The Soldiers' and Sailors' Monument in 1898, etc.). Rooms: Our room was very nice. We stayed in a corner suite. Service: Hotel had two very nice restaurant/bar areas for guest to dine and have drinks. Value: I think our rate was $399.00 per night. We were in-town during the FDIC show which is one of their busiest weeks. Sleep Quality: Excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Conrad Indy - Excellent”
Reviews.Author: bjandljtravels
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Indianapolis Conrad in Oct. 2009 for one night on business. The hotel deserves its excellent rating in nearly every category. The lobby, rooms, business center, meeting rooms are all top-class. Did not eat at the restaurant but the bar was very busy during the middle of the week. The service and friendliness of the staff are top-notch. The room in particular is extremely well-appointed with many nice features. The only down-side is that the hotel is the very expensive - worth it but on the high end for the Indy area.

Reviews.Title: “Top of the line hotel!”
Reviews.Author: sigs99
Reviews.Content: The staff at the Conrad are some of the best in the business. From the maid service to the manager I did not have one complaint on any of them. The staff was always friendly and smiling. They made us feel at home. The lobby is awesome. You can tell how your stay is going to be as soon as you walk in. You can see the craftsmanship from the floor to the ceiling. The lobby was large enough that we never felt crowded at check in or check out. The room was very spacious. The beds are extremely comfortable with top of line bedding. The large flat screen tv was a real plus for the room. The room offered a great work area with a leather chair and a leather waste basket. There was still room for a comfy chair. The room had a seperate refreshment area. They offered free flavored coffee and pay mini bar with everything from snacks to alcohol. They also had some very nice glasses to choose from. The most impressive thing that this room offered was the bathroom. A stand alone glass shower and a seperate tub. The tub offered a pull out shower head. The flat screen tv could be viewed anywhere in the bathroom since it was on a swivel. My wife enjoyed the tub so much she took 3 baths in 2 days. The bathroom also had a phone, hair dryer, and a magnifying mirror for make up. The closet had an iron and ironing board. Plenty of room for storage and coats. It was alaso stocked with 2 of the best robes that I have ever used. We have stayed at several hotels in the past and we both agree that the Conrad is on the top of our list. We would recommend this hotel to anyone. We would return w/o a second thought.

Reviews.Title: “Simply amazing”
Reviews.Author: Romatod
Reviews.Content: This by far is the best hotel I ever stayed at. The place is spotless and decorated to the fullest with fresh flowers every day. The customer service is professional and the staff will help you with anything possible. For example it was late one night and I ran out of cigarettes. So what did they do is they went to the hotel down the road and got them for me. No questions asked. This Conrad as a full Spa, Wine Tastings, Amazing Capitol Grille Restaurant, Pool/Fitness Center/Hot Tub/Sauna/Steam Room and tons more of other things to make you're stay even better. My Room was very clean, comfortable and the bed was simply to die for. The bathrooms are all marble with a separate shower and bath tub including a flat screen television in each room. The Conrad is not like most hotels with contemporary furniture and style. This place as a real down to earth homey kind of feel to it. Reminds me of New England and just feeling like you're at you're home away from home. The Conrad is centrally located near Lucas Oil stadium and the Convention Center. Everything that you want to do see or eat is within walking distance from the hotel. You don't need to get a rental unless of course you need one. The people here at the Conrad perform there jobs with superior quality. I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone that plans to be staying near downtown Indy. Thank you Conrad Indy for giving me the best time of my life before my deployment to Afghanistan. I will make it my priority to stay at the Conrad when I get back from this war and meet up with there amazing staff.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, quiet, restful sleep”
Reviews.Author: themenz
Reviews.Content: The Conrad is well located right across from a mall and about two blocks from the convention center. Has a spa, but we did not try. We were on the 18th floor and had a great view of downtown. Room was squeeky clean and almost eerily quiet. We never heard anything from outside, next door or even if someone was taking a shower in our room. Service was very good with the concierge printing a color document at 9 pm for me at no charge. Nice lobby with a happening wine bar and a restaurant off to each side. Wine bar has 100s of wines with those tasting machines. Also offers tapas to go with your beverage. The separate restaurant is an upscale steak place. Elevators are fast and require a key to get to your floor. Room has a nice size closet, small bar with a nifty single cup coffee/tea maker. Room had a big flat screen, standard desk, wing chair, small sofa and glass coffee table. Bed was super comfortable with a feather top and down comforter. Great linens with high thread count. They only give you sheets every third day unless you request it daily. OK by me! Bathroom had a phone and small flatscreen (nice touch), lighted magnifying make up mirror, single sink, plenty of great soap, lotion, shampoo etc. Huge double head shower meant for wheelchair access. Try Patachou restaurant for breakfast. About 1 city block away, very good food, excellent wheat toast-tastes home baked, great coffees, reasonable prices. PF Changs is right across the street.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel with friendly staff in great location”
Reviews.Author: kingofelsmere
Reviews.Content: We stayed for one night and thought this hotel was great. It has a great location in the middle of downtown within easy walking distance to Panera Bread, Ruth's Chris, St. Elmos, and the mall. Hotel was very clean. The staff were very friendly and went out of their way to see if we needed any assistance each time we talked to them or met them in the public areas. The room was standard size, but the bathrooms are great and so are the large flat screen TV's. If you don't want to pay $32 for nightly valet parking I recommend the garage around the corner that's a short walk to the front of hotel and charges $20 day max.

Reviews.Title: “Best in Indy”
Reviews.Author: MichiganJim2009
Reviews.Content: Went for a weekend swim competition with the kids. The hotel was excellent. Over the years I ahve stayed at every Indy hotel and this place is the winner. There is a new JW Marriott being built a few blocks away and I think the Conrad has stepped it up even more, Staff is freindly. Their coffee shop is actually the Capital Grille and the breakfast is outsatnding and priced within reason. Rooms are very very comfortable and service throughout is understated in a very professional way. Valet parking is expensive and you may have to wait awhile for your car, they are limited by the one way streets. As far as Indy goes, this is the only place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “relaxed pampering”
Reviews.Author: Silverdeer
Reviews.Content: The comfort,cleanliness and character of the accomodation was superb. There was not a single thing with which to be able to find fault. We were relaxed and truly enjoyed our stay, as well as a superior dinner at the Capital Grill. Whether one evening, weekend or a week, we would recommend a stay at the Conrad in Indianapolis. It was a great way to celebrate an anniversary.

Reviews.Title: “An unexpected gem”
Reviews.Author: LumpyVt
Reviews.Content: The Conrad Indianapolis is a big city five star hotel dropped into a midwest capital. The rooms are large, clean and quiet. Beds are excellent. The staff is the true treasure. From the time that a cab door is opened on arrival to when another door is opened at departure, staff is consistently unobtrusive and responsive. Every request is handled with aplomb. The facilities are also top shelf. If Hilton can replicate the Indianapolis level of quality as it rolls out the Conrad brand across the world, it will have a winner.

Reviews.Title: “FABULOUS!!!!!!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: lexyIndianapolis
Reviews.Content: My experience at the Conrad can not even be described in words!!! From the very moment we opened the car doors to valet park to the end of our stay, it was more than fabulous! Every person we spoke with from the desk manager to the bar to the restaurant was more than friendly! Everything about the room was spectacular and clean that once I got to the room, I didn't even want to leave! Thank you to everyone at the Conrad hotel for making our stay the best ever! I highy recommend staying there if you are ever in the Indy area! Thanks again!! Chad and Abby Jackson

Reviews.Title: “Can't wait to get back!”
Reviews.Author: dpj835
Reviews.Content: We came to town after some Christmas shopping and to catch a Colts game. We had reservations at the Conrad and from the moment we pulled up, we were treated like the best. Our car was valet parked and as we walked in, the beauty of this hotel was amazing. The front desk service was very polite and even held our bags while we went to the game. The room was beautiful, clean and loaded with top notch amenities; large flat screen HDTV, king size bed, great linens and the best part... the shower and bath facilities. The Capital Grille and a great wine tasting bar were openly attached to this hotel The Conrad is convenient to anything that you would want to do in downtown Indy. In short, we would not hesitate to stay here again and as a matter of fact, we are anxiously awaiting the next trip to Indy. When we come back, we'll be at the Conrad.

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel, service not great”
Reviews.Author: onehaqq
Reviews.Content: Me and my wife stayed at the Conrad on New Year's Eve. We had planned to stay 2 nights, but checked out after only 1. The rooms were decent - although somewhat small. For such a new property, and especially a Conrad, I was expecting better. I am a Gold Honors member and stay at Hiltons quite often, so this hotel was very similar to the upper end Hiltons I have stayed at. That being said, the service at this hotel was not good in my opinion. Granted it was New Years Eve, and people are expected to be partying that night, our floor was like a free-for-all anything goes bar brawl. All night long people were yelling and screaming, there were fights in the hallways, and people were knocking on our door in the middle of the night drunk. I called security several times and nothing was done about the issue. Again, I know it is New Year's Eve, but this was ridiculous. This was going on until 6am. There was also a big New Year's Eve bash at the hotel and a lot of party goers probably got rooms at the hotel, but the hotel environment was beyond ridiculous. The next morning, I complained to the manager of the hotel who kept insisting that this was due to it being New Year's Eve and that once a year, people like to let off a little steam and the other 364 days of the year, the hotel is fine. I explained that I wanted to check out immediately and would not be staying the additional night on my reservation. Yes, I understand that Conde Nest Traveler has this hotel on this Gold List - so I expected the management to promptly listen to my compaints and quickly refund the cost of the room. I have had similar problems at other properties, and as a Gold Member, this is what I would expect. However, after 15 minutes of explaining to the manager that the safety, comfort, and security of hotel guests should be a priority, he finally said he would take 1/2 off the rate. To make it worse, I just noticed the hotel charged a $75 early departure fee, which is absolutely unacceptable. This fee was not on my receipt at the time of checkout, and I was checking out early because there was a problem at the hotel - plus the manager did not inform me of the early departure fee upon checkout. This is absolutely ridiculous and I will not be staying at this hotel ever again.

Reviews.Title: “SLIPPING BADLY SINCE LAST VISIT”
Reviews.Author: garyfong
Reviews.Content: We visit Indianapolis fairly often, and typically stay at the Conrad. I don't know if it has a new General Manager (a FAX sent to the GM outlining the details of my stay has had no response) but this hotel is now a nice property, well located, but poorly managed. I haven't checked to see if other guests have posted on here, but as I was having breakfast in the Capital Grille, one guest stormed out saying that she waited a very long time and had been seated, but nobody offered her a menu, so she left. Here's what happened on our stay. Around midnight, we got a call from the operator. Could we let engineering in to fix the plumbing in our room? The room below us was flooding. We were very tired, so we asked if we could wait until the morning. We turned in, to be called again. Please, they asked, could they come in now? We would be provided with a free night stay. (big deal, the rate was $199/night off-season) but we figured it was urgent so we let them in. Two men came OK that story is getting long. Then, the toilet stopped up. Called engineering, they fixed it. Then the tub stopped up and wouldn't drain. Engineering came to fix it, working around the taped up tiles from the repair that came earlier. Lightbulbs weren't changed - called, for a third engineering visit. The AC power on the desk wasn't working, I reported it but it probably didn't get fixed. An important FAX that was to be sent out never got sent. A fax that I sent to the hotel with a cover sheet saying that I would pick it up at the front desk got held for morning delivery (it had my boarding pass) Here's the clincher. When I reviewed my bill, the free-night stay was not credited. I mentioned it to the front desk agent, who said she would adjust it and email me my bill. Not only didn't they not credit the free night stay - they charged an amount equal to an extra night after I checked out! So I called and FAX'd the GM, and have not had a response. I have sent all of this to American Express Centurion travel, so they are made aware of this change in service quality. A hotel is not the property, that's not the product. The product is the combination of service and facility, and this product is half what it used to be. Guests planning on a trouble-free stay with no aggravations should check their expectations now. It is not the property it was a year ago. If you are a business traveler, or a meeting planner considering the Conrad, understand that it appears to be understaffed and aloof. Individual staffers were well-meaning and had a positive attitude, it's just that it seems unorganized and confused.

Reviews.Title: “CHECK YOUR ROOM!”
Reviews.Author: el04
Reviews.Content: 4 of us went to the Conrad to celebrate a BIG BIRTHDAY. We got 2 rooms, which we'd booked several months in advance. 1 room was lovely. Our room had many problems, unfortunately. We checked in and just dropped our bags off to go to dinner at oceannaire (fabulous). When we returned to the room, around 11 pm, we realized we'd been given a handicap accessible room--not a big problem, so we thought. We tried to read before bed, but BOTH of the reading lights were broken. 1 just hung limply and couldn't adjust except to hand toward the floor. The other DID adjust, but the bulb was burnt out--so no reading. In the morning when we went to shower, we realized that the HIGHEST the shower head would go was mid chest. (tough to wash one's hair, unless you crouched down, not to mention your neck and face). It was also a very small shower--unlike our friends who had the great double shower head large shower. Oh well. there was also only ONE large bath towel, although the room was clearly booked for 2 people. We looked for robes after our shower--NONE. (our friends room DID have them). So I don't know if all handicap accessible rooms are like this, or just ours, but for our special occasion, it certainly put a big damper on it. I will say that the beds were VERY COMFORTABLE, the TV was great, so there were many good things about the room--but no reading light, a bad shower and no robes, we were very disappointed. When we mentioned this at checkout they were very apologetic , but that didn't really improve our experience. In short, not what we expected from this kind of hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Close, but not perfect”
Reviews.Author: mketrvlr
Reviews.Content: I received a reasonable rate at this hotel for a weekend stay and looked forward to it based on its reputation. The location has to be the best in Indianapolis. My companion and I were able to take a December evening walk around the beautifully-decorated Circle without spending more than 15 minutes in the falling snow. Everyone we encountered both inside and outside of the hotel was friendly. Unfortunately, the reviews I'd read on this site had me expecting perfection. That was not delivered when I discovered a glaring stain on the cylindrical throw pillow on our bed. It was not delivered when I called the front desk asking for ice and was told that there was a machine on the floor above mine ( the in-room booklet stated ice is delivered and replinished daily ). It was not delivered when I opened the coffee drawer in the morning to find only 2 packets of decaf - no tea, no regular. Friends in another room had no bathrobes in their room. Could phone calls have resolved these issues? Probably - but should this many "fix-it" calls be necessary in a hotel of this caliber? Finally, there was no Fiji water awaiting our arrival as some reviews have stated. This may be a perk reserved for Hilton Honors members. Overall I had a very positive experience at Conrad. The facilities are elegant and the staff friendly. The wine bar, Tastings, provided an enjoyable Saturday evening destination. I'm just not sure if my next visit to Indianapolis will see me at the Conrad or at the soon-to-open JW Marriott a few blocks to the west.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: senorjim
Reviews.Content: Stayed here 2 nights November 7-9, 2009. The hotel is located in a great downtown location. Walking distance to the football stadium. The downtown is very vibrant on a Saturday night. The meals were very good and the service top notch. I am not able to comment on the maid service as my timing did not allow them to make up my room. The room has a large HD flat sceen TV. The bathroom has a seperate tub and shower. The staff in the lobby were always there to open a door and to greet you. They appeared to be very well trained.

Reviews.Title: “If your not loaded go somewhere else”
Reviews.Author: jennie09
Reviews.Content: Ok yes we did get the "low" rate of 149 plus tax so maybe we didnt get the best room? The room was way too small , the furniture was crooked, there was water in our ice bucket, a used brush in the bathroom, and we had to call down for the advertised bath robes that are supposed to be in our room, the dvd player did not work. There our no pop or snack machines although they do have snacks in the room that you must pay for, for ex. a snack sized can of pringles costs 5.00. If you want a fridge or micro it is 25.00 each. And if you dont want to pay 37 dollars for vallet parking you had better make a plan before you come of where to park, we had to lug all our stuff from around the corner. I had planned on splurging for some room service since it was my birthday, but after seeing the prices decided not to. On the brighter side the beds, tvs, and seperate tub and shower were nice. So unless you have a lot of extra dough and dont mind overpaying stay somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Romantic Getaway when you can't really get away!”
Reviews.Author: IndyPrima
Reviews.Content: My husband and I live in Indianapolis and stayed at the Conrad on our wedding night before leaving for Hawaii the next day. We have been married for two years now and have a baby and decided to go back to the Conrad to celebrate our anniversary! We can't really get away with a newborn, but after one night at this wonderful hotel we felt pampered, relaxed, re-energized, and very happy! We both travel for work and have stayed at several very nice hotels, including Ritz Carltons and Waldorf Astoria hotels. The rooms at the Conrad measure up to any that I have stayed in around the world. They are not overly spacious, but extremely comfortable and cozy! If you need a place to stay in Indy, this hotel is worth the extra money! And, I must add that the Capital Grille restaurant in the hotel is amazing! And, I can't wait to try out the new wine bar, Tastings!

Reviews.Title: “great place”
Reviews.Author: Travel_1975
Reviews.Content: One of the best hotels around and I've been around the world. Great staff, great clean rooms, quiet rooms, very new and updated. Good dining in the hotel which rare these days. Justin at the front was a wonderful help and a great person to give you advice about the city. Loved it.

Reviews.Title: “A do-over”
Reviews.Author: monkeymama09
Reviews.Content: The first time we stayed, the concierge had messed up on the refreshments we had ordered to be in our room when we arrived. As an apology, the GM gave us a free night. On our second stay, we enjoyed ourselves, but I think I would just as rather stay at the Omni or Hyatt, especially for the money.

Reviews.Title: “The only place to stay in Downtown Indianapolis.”
Reviews.Author: trvlbug04
Reviews.Content: This hotel is fantastic. Everything about this hotel is beautiful and comfortable. The decor is outstanding, especially the blown glass chandeliers throughout the hotel. The rooms were so comfortable, the bed and shower especially. I adored the dual shower head and the TV in the bathroom so you can watch TV while taking a bubble bath. The bed linens are excellent and we slept so soundly. The lounge in the hotel also has a great vibe and great cocktails. I highly recommend staying here, especially for couples without children who want to treat themselves to a night on the town.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel and underpriced...Magnificent!”
Reviews.Author: Niknak28
Reviews.Content: This hotel is immaculate. From the complimentary valet and the greeters you feel welcome before you even exit the car. You walk in to the aroma of italian food, feel of marble floors, fresh fruit available at check in and check out. Once in your room, you are pleased with the cleanliness. Plush bedding, huge windows onlooking the city scape, flat screen tv in the room and bathroom, wet bar, robes and the shower is magnificnet. The tub is big enough for two!! This hotel is connected to many restaraunts, shopping mall and the price is considerably lower than what one would think. I am so looking forward to going back and this time I will spend time in the spa area.

Reviews.Title: “If an excellent hotel in Indianapolis is your requirement, look no further than the Conrad.”
Reviews.Author: CarolinaSpindrift
Reviews.Content: This hotel was so nice that I spent additional time in Indiana. It has a great overall feel, location and service. When I pulled up to valet parking I was greeted by a polite gentleman named "Conrad". I chuckled and gave him a few jabs about joking around, but he insisted he wasn't joking. Bellboy asked if he could take 7 minutes of my time to show me how my room worked and said yes with the distinct impression he was enjoying his job. There were two HD TV's one in the main room and the bathroom. There was a coffee / drink bar that had everything you would want including a The Timer hour glass which has three separate hourglass timers, which will time 3 minutes, 4 minutes, and 5 minutes. You could simply tell there was a lot of though behind everything in the hotel rooms. Valet service for meetings was 100% reliable, car running and air / heat was on and ready. Meals were good but far from perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Will definitely return!”
Reviews.Author: danyelle2598
Reviews.Content: This hotel was absolutely gorgeous. From the moment the bellboy held the door for you to walk in, I was treated with respect and kindness. The hotel was clean and eveyone seemed to be smiling. My room was fabulous and the beds even moreso. Showerheads were great! I was there with a wedding and the staff (wait and bar - Randy and Conrad!) were wonderful. The food was delicious. The following morning the front desk staff were helpful and accommodating with storing my luggage. Thank you for a wonderful stay!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Stay”
Reviews.Author: titus2woman
Reviews.Content: The Conrad was a wonderful hotel for a weekend getaway. My husband and I stayed there four nights. We were greeted with prompt and friendly service from the valet. We went from our vehicle, thru check-in, to suitcases laid out and clothes in the closet with the assistance of the bellman, in about 5 minutes. We were able to catch a movie within 30 minutes of arriving in town because of the quick service and proximity to Circle Center Mall. The proximity to all of the restaurants, shops, and monuments in downtown Indy, was very nice. The Conrad service desk was quick to answer calls, and always very helpful and cheerful. The valet service was wonderful, always prompt and friendly. The housekeeping service never disturbed us when we indicated Do Not Disturb, but left a note on the door allowing us to call for housekeeping service once we were up and out for the day. We had turn down service one night, and it was so nice to have soft lights and music waiting for us after a night out on the town. The big tub with TV in the bathroom was an added luxury. The Spa Chakra was way overpriced, and even though we had a buy one 1.5 hour treatment and get one free, we did not indulge ($200/1.5 hr massage). Overall, it was a very pleasant stay.

Reviews.Title: “felt like a king”
Reviews.Author: mikedelfino
Reviews.Content: well worth the money. The pool is great and the room is 5 star.. The room service was great and the staff very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel by far!”
Reviews.Author: ScopeDRK
Reviews.Content: I used trip advisor to help me pick this hotel and they were right again! Staff nice, helpful. Room clean, bed soft, walls quiet, bathroom great. Location right across from the mall and next to great restaurants. I ate at the Oceanaire seafood two blocks away. The Capitol Grille is in the hotel and was great. I travel a lot and this place was great. If you are not part of Hilton Honors then sign up. I got two free breakfast coupons at check in. I will always stay here in Indy and if the Conrads are all like this I am there.

Reviews.Title: “The Royal Treatment....”
Reviews.Author: Terrika_n_Mark
Reviews.Content: Ok, this was our second (my third) stay @ the Conrad. This hotel is #1 at spoiling their guests. We stayed for my birthday, and went back on Valentine's Day weekend. The Valet and Concierge were 100% focused on us- hand and foot. The Concierge team is bar none the best. When we arrived, there was an Artisian Cheese Plate and Sparkling Juice (chilling) in our room. The Cheese plate retailing at $35, was complimentary due to the hullabaloo I went through to get a room. They fetched us a second bottle from a nearby store, just to satistfy us. The one issue we had was handled within 10 Minutes. Our HDTV bulb had bust, and as soon as I called down, 10 minutes later, two very personable handymen came up, and promptly and replaced it. He said they are upgrading all the television sets and the manager "donated" hers from her suite (FIRST CLASS!!!!) The in room dining delivery lady was a sweetie pie. We ordered I know at least $40 in Bread pudding (which is Mark's fave!!!! And now mine...) Quite frankly, they made my very first official Valentine's Day one I'll remember for a lifetime! Ok, for the con....since I waited to book, we weren't able to get our typical corner suite- so, we were wedged between a very sensually noisy couple. That's it. *We loved it so much, we got keepsake umbrellas.

Reviews.Title: “Easter Brunch: Terribly disappointing. Bad food, dirty tablecloths.”
Reviews.Author: Brightviolet
Reviews.Content: We attended Conrad's Easter Brunch this year, and were deeply disappointed -very dirty heavily stained table cloth from earlier sittings - bland, unimaginative foods - stale/dry/mushy food that's been sitting out for 24 hours probably - And to boot, after charging $50 per adult (which we knew would be the price), they added a $20 "service charge" to our bill. For just two people!! Service was good, and I would probably have left a 15% tip, but adding a mandatory $20 charge (for a buffet)?? This mandatory charge was not mentioned anywhere by the way, not in advertising, not at the entrance, not by the table, nowhere. It just appeared on our check. Having had Easter brunches at hotels all over the country, this was by FAR the worst, and grossly overpriced with a large unadvertised mandatory service charge to boot. I'm happy to pay $50-60 for an Easter brunch, or even more, but not for what the Conrad offered. Deeply disappointing, really put a damper on our Easter Day.

Reviews.Title: “A fine hotel”
Reviews.Author: Hezekiah
Reviews.Content: My one-night stay at the Conrad was pleasant: My room on the ninth floor was very comfortable and attractive, and reasonably quiet. I appreciated the complimentary high-speed internet connection, and the service was fine. Apart from a minor issue - some spillover of water from the shower onto the bathroom floor- I did not experience any of the negatives noted by some reviewers, who were either exceedingly demanding or experienced what sounded like rare mishaps. I did not use the spa or business center, or dine at the hotel, and so cannot comment about those services. I would certainly consider the Conrad on a future visit to Indianapolis, though I don't know whether this place would be the best value for my money. As a business traveler eligible for corporate rates, I heard of attractive sounding deals at other downtown hotels with good reputations.

Reviews.Title: “Great value”
Reviews.Author: gazooby
Reviews.Content: On a weekday night in January, I paid a fraction of the posted price. For that I got one of the nicest hotel rooms in downtown Indianapolis. Very comfortable, great service. Only quibble I would make is that the room was overcrowded with furniture. Are the five different chairs (desk chair, arm chair, upholstered chair, love seat, bench at foot of bed) really necessary? I banged my hip on corner of desk in middle of night because there were too many chairs in the way!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: C.Parsley
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a wedding and it is a very nice hotel, the Staff was very friendly and check in was a breeze. The only complaint we had was getting our room cleaned on the Saturday before the wedding. We went out shopping at 9:00 and asked that our room be done as we had the wedding at 6:00 and had to get ready. We returned at 1:00 and the room wasn't done yet, asked again about getting the room cleaned and were told "No problem", returned at 3:00 and still wasn't done. I wanted to have a nap before the wedding but that was out, after we asked a 3rd time the room was done at 4:30, so we had time for a shower and got dressed and had to be downstairs for the wedding, so much for my nap. Other than this annoyance, the Hotel is very nice and the rooms very large and modern, my wife & I both found the bed to be harder than what we are accoustomed to at the Hilton chain and we were up early because of it (hence the need for a nap). We would stay here again as it's located right downtown, a block from Ruth Chris (dinner on Friday night) and the Circle Mall is connected via a walkway on the 2nd floor.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous hotel and staff !!”
Reviews.Author: MEMBERNWIN
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 nights Jan. 9-11,2009 with our two children. Where do I start? Everything was wonderful. The front desk staff were very friendly and accommodating. No wait to check in. As a Gold Hilton Honors member, I asked for a room upgrade and was upgraded to a King Corner Suite. We were also given vouchers for complimentary continental breakfast each morning. The lobby is warm and inviting and you can access both restaurants off the lobby upon entering. We were given a room on the 6th floor which is the same level as the pool/fitness center/and spa which was very convenient. The room itself was fabulous. You enter through a door that takes you to a small area with a guest room to the right and the suite door directly ahead. Upon entering, there is a small hallway with a half bath. The living room area is set up nicely with a sofa, 2 arm chairs and a desk area. Both the bedroom and the living room have huge plasma screen tvs. We had a great view of the city and the artgarden. The bedroom has a comfy king bed and another small loveseat. A nice touch are the small reading lamps that come out of the wall on either side of the bed. They also make a great nightlight. The best was that each bathroom had a small plasma screen tv. Great for catching the news in the morning while we were getting ready. The full bathroom also has a dual head shower and a deep soaking tub bath. And unlike the Embassy Suites next door, you control the temperature of the room. Both the bedroom and living room have thermostats. Our last stay in Indy was at the Embassy in November and I remember being miserable both nights because the room was so hot. There are robes and slippers provided in the closet and a complimentary umbrella next to the door for use during your stay. The pool was very clean and quiet. Larger and warmer than most hotels we have stayed with. The hot tub was very large and very clean as well. There are padded lounge chairs around the pool and bottles of water are provided. We did not use the spa or fitness center, but both looked nice as well. The hotel was quiet and we never saw more than 4-5 other people at the pool area while we were there. We ordered room service the first night, the service was quick and the food was great. Continental breakfast was in Vitesse restaurant. The selection was quite good and consisted of oatmeal, several types of pastries and croissants, yogurt, cereals, bagels, toast and fresh fruit consisting of watermelon (suprisingly good considering it is off season), raspberries, and strawberries. There were also apples and oranges available. Coffee, tea and orange juice are brought by the server. The service was excellent. We forgot to get an additional voucher for our children,but each morning the server took care of it for us. The hotel offers valet parking for $32.00, but we chose to park ourselves. The Embassy Suites garage charges $20.00 a day and you can take the walkway from the Embassy over to the Artsgarden and enter the Conrad from there. There is also street parking, but we did not feel safe parking our vehicle on the street. All in all a very relaxing and enjoyable stay. I can't believe this hotel is not rated #1. Except when we travel to Orlando, we only stay with the Hilton brand. Out of all the hotels we have stayed at, this hotel takes care of their VIP's better than any of them. We used to stay at the Embassy Suites next door, but after a bad experience there and the wonderful experience we had at the Corad, there is no question where we will stay upon our next trip to Indy. If you are looking for a first class hotel close to everything, this is the perfect hotel. We are already looking forward to our return trip in March.

Reviews.Title: “Very Comfortable, world class service”
Reviews.Author: Travel_velocity
Reviews.Content: A very comfortable hotel, service is world class. You will feel a difference when you stay here. The artwork in rooms and common areas make the hotel feel less like a hotel, a little less industrial than most. Highly recommended. Capital Grille is in the hotel, so if you like steak this is an outstanding place for dinner. Breakfast is terrific too, no need to leave hotel for that. HIghly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice but Not Pet Friendly”
Reviews.Author: Starwood68
Reviews.Content: We were recommended this hotel because they are Pet Friendly well if you have money to burn I guess. There is a $250 deposit and of that they return $100 they keep $150 for cleaning the room.What? First of all the pet is limited to under 25 lbs so there won't be a Great Dane in there. So I assume they want want to be pet friendly in name only, not to the average traveler.The hotel is beautiful the rooms are very nice and the staff is very helpfull.Parking is also a little high compared to the other hotel downtown it is $32 a day compared to the average of $20-$25.So just a few things to know going in.

Reviews.Title: “Pluses and minuses at the Conrad”
Reviews.Author: DanielBeryl
Reviews.Content: The Conrad is a beautiful new property conviently connected to the downtown mall. Hilton Honors diamond benefits were generous - an upgraded room and complimentary breakfasts. Hotel personnel were friendly and helpful, but service at breakfast in Vitesse was very laid back. It was hard to get the attention of waiters. The spa and heath club were first class, but prices for spa services seemed unusually high. Housekeeping was the weakest link. For two days when our room hadn't been cleaned late in the day, we had to call for service. Basic items like coffee, bath amenities, towels and bath mat weren't always replaced. One day trash was not emptied and the bathroom wasn't cleaned.

Reviews.Title: “Great deal and good location”
Reviews.Author: jgodic
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Conrad with a friend for one night just for a quick weekend getaway. I was mostly impressed. The check-in was a little annoying because at the 3pm check-in time our room was still not ready. But the room was excellent, very large and clean with a nice bathroom. Service was mostly good, requests were responded to promptly. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Weekend Getaway”
Reviews.Author: HospitalityKid
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this wonderful Conrad in October of 2007 for the state marching band finals, and a nice weekend away from college life. Checkin was fast and friendly, our room was on the highest guest floor so we had a great view of the city. Room itself was spacious for a standard king, amazing bedding, and very luxuriously appointed with flat screen tvs in bedroom and bathroom. Glass double head shower was great, and the deep soaking tub was even better. Breakfast from room service was timely and delicious, and maid service was great. Loved the two nights we spent here and did not want to leave. Another great hotel, and hope to come back again!

Reviews.Title: “Setting the standard for Indianapolis”
Reviews.Author: RJ_LG
Reviews.Content: As other reviewers have noted, this hotel sets the standard not just for Indianapolis, but for being one of the best chain (Hilton) hotels in the country. Huge, luxurious rooms; staff who are willing to help with requests from the banal (more towels) to the sublime (babysitting!); amazing indoor pool / gym / spa combo; and outstanding business environment are all in the hotel's favor. In 10 weeks of staying at the property, I did have a couple of billing glitches at the property (double-billed once, billed a no-show fee for a reservation I honored), but both were quickly resolved. I found the rooms next to the elevators to be annoyingly loud - this applies both to the hotel elevators and to the high-rise elevators which take residents to the condos above the hotel. It's worth asking for a room away from the elevators.

Reviews.Title: “Conrad does it right!”
Reviews.Author: sciroccokid
Reviews.Content: Service was very good! Asked for room with view and given great view of circle. Being connected to mall is a convenience. Location is right in the middle of everything! Pool, jacuzzi, gym and locker rooms were extremely clean and not overcrowded. Room was great with TV in bathroom, comfortable bed, large picture window and seemed well insulated as never heard any noise from hallway or other rooms. Hotel is safety conscience. Elevators a bit small but quick. Valet pricey but prompt. No ice machines on floors but guest services provide ice pretty quickly and ice delivered with evening turn down service helpful. Reading lights are good and Conrad has in-room safes. Go and enjoy the pool area, excellent rooms, overall service and shows and wonderful food at the great restaurants that are in walking distance. Wish we were still there!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Would look forward to staying again.”
Reviews.Author: Edgingin
Reviews.Content: Billed as the only 5-star hotel in Indiannapolis, this is certainly a very comfortable, well-designed property. The only reason I'm having a hard time rating this a "5" is because of a disorganized check-in experience. It's always frustrating when there's a line of people waiting and only one person to serve (3 bellman curbside, but only one person at the desk?) Still, I'd look forward to visiting again. Some highlights; - Convenient business services including easy in-room internet access - Luxurious beds that put the Heavenly Bed to shame - Spacious bathrooms with deep soaking tub, Moulton Brown products and a TV - 52" Plasma in-room

Reviews.Title: “The Conrad is unbeatable.”
Reviews.Author: Ordeal_seeker
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent our 20th anniversary at the Conrad. Everything about the hotel is excellent. Our room was very comfortable. Be sure to check out the pool, it's has a very interesting design. The Conrad is close to many excellent restaurants in downtown Indianapolis.

Reviews.Title: “Housekeeping needs some serious Attention!!!”
Reviews.Author: Waimanalo96795
Reviews.Content: I attended a seminar that was being held at the Hyatt (kitty corner to the Conrad) during the week of Aug. 18. Because I had a great deal of points, I decided to splurge my points on the Conrad since I wanted to treat myself to a well deserved rest. Conrad was rated so much better than the Hyatt (& even the Embassy which was right next door). So instead of using the freebie breakfast, etc. which comes with the Embassy, I chose to use the 200,000 points for the Conrad. No problem with booking through the Hyatt rewards program. Got checked into the hotel (which seemed fairly vacant during my stay) all right. Very pleasant front desk personnel & was shown around my room by the luggage porter. The room itself is VERY nice. The bed was so inviting, the bathroom was large & the shower had 2 large heads. TheTV in the room was crystal clear (great for watching the Olympics). It's great to have a TV in the bathroom for watching the morning news while you're getting ready. That part was excellent. Things just went downhill from there, considering the type of hotel this is. I stayed 5 nights & every single day brought a new & unnecessary challenge. The coffee maker is a Keurig & it comes supplied with various single serve coffee/tea cartridges. That was great, but the sugar/creamer that was left was only enough for 1 cup. Call me weird, but I like a decent amount of sugar (real) & cream for my tea. On the first night, I also realized ththat the bathroom TV remote didn't work. I left a note for housekeeping that I needed more sugar/cream & about the remote. Came home Mon. afternoon from my class & the remote was repaired, but no sugar/cream was left. I went downstairs to ask to have someone replace it when I went out that night. That night I used the comfy robe in the room after my bubble bath (by the way, the way the tub is situated, there is no choice but to flood the bathroom floor because the water that spills out on the sides funnels right to the floor -- design flaw!!). I hung it up & when I returned from class on Tues. night, it was gone. Assuming it was replaced, I looked in the closet, but no robe. Wed. am, I left another note (with a tip daily) to replace the robe, sugar/cream reminder, shampoo replaced, etc. I shampoo/ condition daily & left the mostly used bottles in the shower, but they never got replaced, even when they went empty. Even soap was iffy. The towels were either 2 face clothes & no hand towel, until I asked for one. Well, I got the robe back, but no shampoo or sugar/cream. By this time, I was pilfering the sugar/cream from our coffee table at the Hyatt and was doing a slow burn over this. I didn't think another visit downstairs should have to happen since the first time should have cleared it up. Wed. afternoon I finally got another bottle of shampoo, but the hotel must have still been out of sugar/cream. The first 2 days a Conrad bottle of water was given, but it ended completely after that, so I don't know if that was a one time only thing. On Thurs., I left a soaked robe that I hoped would be replaced (from another flooded tub soak), but when I got back around 5pm from my class, the room wasn't made up. I left about an hour later to go to a banquet & when I returned after midnight, it still hadn't been made up -- NOTHING!!! I went to bed, no new towels, robe or anything. I was too tired & didn't want to yell at anyone. I checked out at noon on Fri. & told the front desk that my room wasn't made up. The poor girl didn't know how to respond, but muttered that I wasn't the only one that complained about that. I don't know what on earth is going on with housekeeping there, but it needs to be addressed. I hope management reads this & reacts to the problem. Totally inexcusable for the type of hotel this is. I opted for this hotel since conferance hotels are usually overwhelmed & service suffers, but did this backfire on me or what? I'm sure this is not the norm for the Conrad brand, but my experience certainly was disappointing. The room was the only saving grace (but not when I didn't have clean, dry towels), but I just wanted to cry at some point. I wasted 200,000 hard earned points.

Reviews.Title: “First Rate”
Reviews.Author: Indyrk
Reviews.Content: This is a beautiful hotel! My wife and I stayed here while in town to see a show. The 1 king bed room we booked was huge, very clean, and very well appointed. Staff was very attentive and friendly throughout. I will definitely stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Stay!”
Reviews.Author: mdigirl
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Conrad last November during the Pats vs Colts game. From the second we got stepped foot in the hotels pick up car service, we knew we were in for a treat. The Conrad went above and beyond my expectations. The hotel was immaculate! The front desk & customer service staff were always one step ahead of me answering any question I had. They had great suggestions on restaurants and area shopping, as well as the best tailgating areas in the city before the big game. The only downside to our weekend trip was the Colts losing. Next time we are in Indianapolis (and we are hoping it will be soon....we just LOVE this city!), we will definitely be returning to stay at the Conrad.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant”
Reviews.Author: texastech
Reviews.Content: Had a pleasant stay at the Indy Conrad. There was a slight glitch with the room, but the staff and manager were on top of it and made sure that we were happy. Food at the lounge was good, and the attached Capitol Grille was fabulous. I would definitely stay here again on my next trip to Indianapolis.

Reviews.Title: “Heaven on Earth!”
Reviews.Author: mkgesq
Reviews.Content: I am a VERY frequent business traveler. Hands down...this is one of the top 3 BEST hotels I have ever stayed at during my business travels (list includes Ritz, Four Seasons & JW Marriott). First-rate accommodations and service: check-in, room, amenities, room design, etc (I can watch The Today Show during my shower thanks to a flat panel in bathroom!). All top shelf!! Apparently, Conrad Hilton wasn't only smart in disinheriting Paris...he knows a thing or two on how to run an immaculate, first rate, top shelf hotel as well (before this, I was wondering why Hilton was still such a big hotel chain). Staff: 1st rate in all respects - clearly they have employed those who take this job very seriously and know how to deliver. First time in Indy (fantastic city!) but I will be seeking out the Conrad brand for future stays in this and other cities (Gold Hilton member but didn't know about Conrad brand of hotels, sadly). Although I know I'm in a hotel, I really feel as if I'm at home, which is a huge plus for the frequent business traveler. Absolutely ZERO complaints (one minor warning - directions on hotel website from airport to hotel are wrong....call for directions). I hate to leave tomorrow. This place has been incredible. Already looking forward to my next say here!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: KingTito
Reviews.Content: Everything about my stay here for 2 nights was almost perfect. From the check in process. Nice touches like the bellman sneaking a look at my luggage tag, radioing to the front desk so when I got up therey, they already started the check in process. Of substance, the room I had was very large and extremely comfortable. Large flatscreen TV, free wifi, huge bathroom. Perfectly clean. Overall, the room is hard to fault. The fitness center is good. Only two treadmills which is a problem but the equipment is great and the place is very clean. The capital grille is a wonderful restaurant. Great wine list, the 14oz filet I had was perfect. The location is nice. I didn't go shopping but saw a lot of nice stores. There are many restaurants nearby. Oceanaire is a great restaurant. There are plenty of bars and things like that nearby. I am definitely going to only stay here when I return to Indianapolis. Clean, comfortable, reasonably priced.

Reviews.Title: “Inconsistent at best”
Reviews.Author: cagood
Reviews.Content: This hotel is certainly nice enough, but really not much different than many 3 and 4 star hotels. Additionally, it doesn't seem on the same par of 5 star hotels in other midwest locations such as Chicago. The entire stay was overwhelmingly average and inconsistent. The staff was cordial, but not overly kind or friendly. The double room is advertised as being the same as the king, but it lacked any sort of casual seating. Exact quote from the website regarding the double room: The Deluxe Two Double rooms offer the same comfort and upscale amenities as the Deluxe King rooms, but they also feature an additional bed with Conrad's signature upscale bedding which is unique to the brand. However, there was no couch, arm chair, or other casual seating in the double room. I was quite unhappy that the only place to sit in the room was the desk chair ... not comfortable. Overall, the room was rather small and not conducive to relaxation. The room was clean, but the towels in the bathroom were stained. We were told that parking was $30 a night, but then only charged $25 for our entire stay (3 nights -- no one could give a reason). The food was adequate, but the wait staff made the experience feel rushed. The wireless internet was slow and spotty. The pool was closed, but the exercise room was nice. Simply too inconsistent for the price and the 5 star rating.

Reviews.Title: “THE Place to Stay in Indianapolis”
Reviews.Author: ksfmom
Reviews.Content: I just returned from a two night stay at this property and wanted to share my experience. Every aspect of my stay was outstanding - from the check-in process to the valet delivering my car when I was ready to leave. As a woman traveling alone, I especially appreciated the security provided and professional service exhibited by all members of the staff. The room was lovely and the bed was absolutely luxurious. The evening turn -down service was a real treat - complimentary bottled water by the bed, fresh ice in the silver ice bucket, jazz music softly playing from the bedside CD player, and lights on dim in the bathroom with the TV in the bathroom turned on to the next day's happenings at the hotel. My request for a late check-out was accommodated with no problems. When the bellman noticed that I had been waiting for a few moments to check-out, he proceeded to handle the whole process at his station, even offering to print out directions for my trip out of the city. While I did not visit either of the restaurants on-site, the food provided for our meetings (breakfast and lunch for three days) was very tasty and well presented...all the participants anticipated the next day's offerings, as they were so much better than the fare usually provided at meetings of this sort...another real testimony to this hotel's standards. I am looking forward to returning with my family.

Reviews.Title: “Favorite Hotel in Indy”
Reviews.Author: LizzChicago
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Conrad twice within the last 2 months for business. This is my hotel of choice for Indianapolis because of the excellent service and fabulous rooms. I love the beds - they are a dream. The bathrooms are large and beautiful. I love the fitness center because the equipment is well maintained and they provide water and towels. I book my trips to Indianapolis around being able to stay at the Conrad now. If it's not available I won't go. It's wonderful to be spoiled a little when you are on the road away from home for business.

Reviews.Title: “Not quite where they should be”
Reviews.Author: Indyblonde
Reviews.Content: The Conrad is a beautiful hotel and certainly stands way above any other major hotel in town. The rooms, beds, bathrooms are first rate. And the restaurant/bar Vitesse is terrific as is the Capital Grille, although the Grille is not owned by the Conrad. The thing about the hotel that's really irritating is the lack of attention to detail. For example, when we arrived, the sitting room in our suite was freezing. The air coming out of the vent was cold. We called, and of course it was fixed right away, but after a while it got to be 80 degrees and stayed that way the rest of the stay. We couldn't use the room at all. It turns out that the registers have to be adjusted manually to either hot or cold. So if your room gets too hot, it requires an engineer. Both the toilets stopped flushing at the same time. We called downstairs and then left the room to have breakfast. An hour later they were still not working. We called again, and somebody finally came up. Turns out he was busy fixing a problem in the garage. The hotel only has one person who can use a plunger? I took a shower just before we were ready to leave. I opened the drawer and discovered the hair dryer was missing. I waited about ten minutes (3 phone calls) with dripping hair before somebody delivered the dryer. None of these items are a big deal, but this is a hotel that claims to be special and unique and as far as I can tell, the customer service is NOT either of these things. I probably won't stay at the Conrad again. If I were the manager of this hotel, I would make sure that more than one person could come up with a plunger so that a guest doesn't have to wait. And what about a checklist for the cleaning people. Bathrobe, check, shampoo, check, hairdryer, check.

Reviews.Title: “Room for Improvement”
Reviews.Author: turk26
Reviews.Content: I just returned from a two night stay and disapointment is an understantment. From the time I checked in until I left there were ongoing problems with the service. Curb side service was non existent. Check in time was 3:00 PM. I got my room at 4:00 PM. It took repeated requests to have the down pillows and comforters replaced despite making this request with my reservation. An extra bathrobe was requested and finally delivered at 2:00 AM. An order to room service was lost and never delivered. The resturuant basically ran out of food New Year Eve morning. We were not charged for the meager selection that remained. For the price the level of service was dismal. This will be my one and only stay.

Reviews.Title: “The best hotel in Indy!!!”
Reviews.Author: 222racer
Reviews.Content: As I write this I am sitting in the hotel (I couldn't wait to share this experience). I booked a corner King suite initially and then 2 of my daughters decided to come along, so at the last minute the hotel accomodated us with another deluxe room with 2 double beds that is right across a little vestibule (which has it's own access door to the hallway). So, we can leave both of our rooms open and just lock the door to the hallway! (Not your traditional connecting room, but it works!) First let me say that we have been coming to Indy for Thanksgiving for over 20 years. We have stayed at the Westin, then the Hyatt, then I found the Conrad online through a search of hotels that connect to the Circle Centre Mall. From the moment we checked in there has been nothing but exceptional service! The rooms are outstanding, from the flat screen televisions (In a corner suite you'll have 4!) to the enormous soaking tubs, to the mini bars, and the nightly turn-down service in which they leave bottled water and fill up your ice buckets! The room service menu is 24 hours and the food is delivered in 30 minutes or less. Excellent food and consistently more than expected... If you order a scoop of ice cream they include a homemade chocolate chip cookie! I spent a day in the Spa Chakra and I do not have words to express the exceptional sensorial experience! Lets just say Spa Chakra provides the ultimate experience in day and destination spas. I really must mention the level of "quiet" that this hotel offers (no banging overhead or people coming on and off the elevators) actually allowed my husband to oversleep this morning...BLISS! All this to say we will be looking forward to coming back next year and we still have 3 days left on this reservation!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Stay at the Conrad”
Reviews.Author: ChgoDiver
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the Conrad in Indy. Overall we enjoyed our stay at the Conrad and would highly recommend this place. This is a relatively new property that is head and shoulders above the other hotels in Indy. The Property: The lobby is beautiful and well appointed. We noticed two things: First, there is little to no furniture in the lobby. Although it was a slick lobby with polished stone all over, it certainly was not a "cozy" lobby that invites you to sit and socialize. In fact, the hotel had little if any such areas save for the bar/restaurants. Somewhat bizzare. Second, the restaurant/bar is not closed off from the lobby. So when we arrived from Chicago and entered the lobby a cabaret singer in the bar was ironically belting out "Sweet Home Chicago." Her voice reverberated throughout the lobby (not surprisingly given the lack of furniture). It was so loud that I could not even hear the front desk clerk inform me where my room was. I liked that they had live music, but didn't like the set-up. The Room: The doors to the rooms were noticeably thick and made of polished wood. Our room was a little small, (perhaps 320 sq ft?) but we had a great view. Our room was overfurnished giving it a crowded feel. Nevertheless, it was tastefully decorated and well-supplied with bottled water, snacks and various amenities. The centerpiece of the room is the hutch that holds the very large flat panel television. And for the first time ever in my hotel experience, the high definition television actually broadcasted high definition television stations. BRAVO! What a nice surprise. The bed was luxurious and remarkably comfortable. Perhaps it was the highlight of the room. The bathroom had nice stone work, including marble countertop (single vanity). Molton Brown amenities. The mirror, however, was poorly and crookedly installed. The television in the bathroom was a nice touch and indicates that the Conrad had the solo business traveler in mind. I suppose that's why they did not have a separate water closet for the toilet. Understandable, but not convenient for guests that may need to use the bathroom simultaneously. The restaurant/bar and the Capital Grille: we did not eat at the restaurant but ordered a drink from the bar. They poured a generous glass of wine and champagne for us; not stingy at all, which is refreshing. The restaurant appeared to serve a continental breakfast. We opted for something more substantial at the Cap. Grille which did not fail to satisfy. Nice breakfast. The workout room/pool: The workout room is very nice. It has complimentary botlted water. They have TechnoGym equipment which looks nice, but is, in my opinion, inferior to several other brands (Nautilus, LifeFitness). The pool was small but well maintained and clean. I would guess 18-20 yards long and 2-3 lanes wide. It did not seem to be designed for fitness as they had no swimming lines on the bottom of the pool, no lane lines, and no swim fitness equipment (i.e., bring your own). They had a hot tub in the pool area which was fine. We did not check out the "spa" facilities. The Service: The front desk clerk was courteous, but not necessarily polished. The bell staff and valets were attentive, but were a little lethargic or reticent in approaching the guests to inquire about assistance. The use of "Mr. and Mrs ______" was absent other than when we used the phone (and our names flashed in front of the guest services person). Overall, this is a great property. Because of the good, but unpolished service and smaller, crowded rooms, I would not classify this property as five star. Its employees need some extra training and presence for that to happen. The property is nice, but not extravagent. The rooms do not have the room size or layout of a Four Seasons or a Ritz which are a little more generous with space (less crowded, double vanities, separate water closet etc). Nevertheless, this is a high end hotel that is definitely the best stay in Indy. Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay at the Conrad”
Reviews.Author: rsp1
Reviews.Content: I'm familiar with the Conrad chain (Hilton's high end) from traveling in Asia, but had never seen nor stayed in one in the US. Overall, I had an excellent experience and doubt any other hotel in Indy can come close. The 1.5 year old hotel benefits from an excellent and helpful staff, large/modern rooms (huge flatscreen, multiple extra power outlets, wireless, bathroom TV, etc). Rooms were very clean with great beds, shower and furniture. The location is walking distance to downtown and the valet is prompt. I did not have a chance to check out the gym facilities. The only negative was surprisingly poor room service quality. While my order was delivered exactly on time (and to my specifications), there is a lack of breakfast diversity (nothing close to healthy or creative) and the food quality is low. Given the lobby steakhouse, perhaps lunch/dinner are better. Overall, I wouldn't hesitate to stay here again. I would rank this hotel above certain Ritz/Four Seasons in the midwest/texas area.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly staff and very modern Hotel”
Reviews.Author: IrelandRita
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a 3 night stay at the Conrad, Indianapolis and overall this is a lovely modern hotel with friendly staff. We picked the rate which included Continental breakfast which was very good value. The rooms were clean and nicely decorated and the bathroom was excellent. Even had a TV in it. We ate at the Capital Grille in the Hotel. The food was good if not a bit overpriced but we found the waiter a bit standoffish. Perhaps it was because we had a 6 year old with us and this is mainly a business hotel. The hotel has access to the shopping Mall via an indoor skywalk which was a great plus as it rained on our first day. This is a lovely hotel but be careful when parking your car. When we asked for our car on our departure morning we were told we needed a new battery as the car would not start. There has never been a problem with the battery in this car. The staff said they tried jump leads but could not get the car going and they could organise a new battery. I was not sure whether this was genuine or they were looking to make a fast buck. Turned out they had left the lights on overnight and this drained the batterry. The car was restarted after my sister went to check out the car and the valet eventually got a car with a bigger house power to connect the jump leads too. As we were rushing to make an appointment this delayed us and we ended up being late for the appointment.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Conrad!!”
Reviews.Author: wheechairaunt
Reviews.Content: Hubby and I went to Indy for a concert at the Murat. I am disabled, in a wheelchair and the entire Conrad staff were very helpful. Accessible room was very nice and comfortable. Very easy to manuver my wheelchair around. Beds were super comfy but a tad high for the Handicap to get into. Doormen always ready to open the door for us, Belhops explained everything about the room in great detail. We didn't dine at the hotel because there are many places to eat just outside within a block of the hotel. Ruths Chris was my husbands favorite, while I'd have to pick Buca di Beppo's. Both which are handicap accessible.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT hotel!”
Reviews.Author: LexaPT
Reviews.Content: The Conrad in Indy was an absolutely amazing stay for us. I traveled there on business and had a great stay. The rooms are well appointed. The bathroom was tiled in marble and had a seperate bath and shower - with a TV you could watch from the tub! The bed was extremely comfortable and the flat screen TV was perfect. Check in and out was easy and the staff was very helpful. There was some question about a can of soda from the minibar which was cleared up easily and quickly. The hotel is connected with the mall there and is in walking distance to downtown restaurants and the basketball arena. Overall I loved my stay and I would stay there again in a heartbeat!

Reviews.Title: “Spa Chakra @ Conrad....GREAT!”
Reviews.Author: IndyAnna0418
Reviews.Content: Escape in the city of Indianapolis at Spa Chakra at the Conrad! First class spa with first class staff, products, fitness area and pool. No need to travel out west or Chicago seeking the ultimate spa treatments or therapies. I highly recommend the 90 minute massage, 2 hour hydrating body wrap with vichy shower, and a facial! Top off your day spa experience with an overnight at the Conrad. In-room dining had limited food options but the bed was amazing with fluffly pillows, comforters and cool 400 count sheets. They do need cd players in the room. I could have had a room on a higher floor. I was on the 14th floor with a limited city view. I brought my own dvd's and watched movies, ordered room-service and drank wine during my escape. Breakfast in-room was delicious and fast the next morning. Valet parking was great and the bell man helped me manuever out onto the busy street and on my way the next morning. Also note, the hotel is right across the street from the mall and in close proximity to many restuarants. The Capital Grill is right in the hotel and has great steaks!

Reviews.Title: “Just fantastic”
Reviews.Author: Daoda
Reviews.Content: It's frankly amazing that Indianapolis has a hotel of this quality. Everything was top notch. Spacious rooms, luxurious bed, stylish furnishings, great shower, large HDTV, super service. The only thing I could possibly find to quibble about would be the street noise, but that is probably more the fault of Indy's above average number of muffler-less motorcycles. I couldn't imagine staying anywhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel facility I have ever stayed in, service was wanting”
Reviews.Author: oldTTtraveler
Reviews.Content: As far as facilities go, this hotel was the nicest I have ever used. The service was a bit wanting. Although the staff was very nice, the restaurant had several people waiting to be seated with several tables still needing to be bussed. Also, we did not receive what we ordered for breakfast when we used room service on one occasion. Other than these two things, the stay was great.

Reviews.Title: “Very Expensive”
Reviews.Author: sb42
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very impressive but very expensive. We really enjoyed dinner, and the bar. I did get a massage at the hotel, and i enjoyed every second. Overall the trip and hotel was very relaxing and laidback. The staff is very attentive.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: nyctraveler300
Reviews.Content: I loved the Conrad - the service, room, location and amenities are amazing. Sunday brunch is the best thing I've ever seen! I definitely recommend this hotel to anyone who wants to experience luxury.
